samples: the internet boom in the last two to three years has sent information technology it companies tripping over each other to spot the next money-making trend and they seem to have zeroed in on the same idea -- business transactions over the net `` electronic commerce '' and `` e-business '' are the latest buzzwords at leading it companies including ibm corp and digital equipment corp where engineers are trying to come up with an array of choices for people and companies to buy and sell in cyberspace at the internet world international conference held in singapore in late january speeches workshops exhibitions and meetings with the media centred on the promise of electronic commerce the push factors while the debate rages on over just how useful and profitable electronic commerce can be it companies are not waiting for the dust to settle `` the technology is n't perfect but the business incentive is so compelling it 's worth the risk the biggest risk is to do nothing '' rose ann giordano digital 's vice president internet business group said in her keynote address the expectation that a huge number of people will be surfing the net is pushing companies in that direction `` close to 40 million people are expected on-line by year 's end '' said john patrick ibm 's vice president of internet technology `` how will businesses take advantage of the ability to reach an increasing number of people around the world via the internet and intranets `` e-business is what will change the economies of the world it will allow businesses to reach out to touch constituencies they could n't before '' he said ibm has identified three areas in e-business -- ways to conduct commerce business collaboration and managing content on the internet question on profit and usefulness analysts say the stage is set for electronic commerce but it may not prove to be immediately profitable for businesses operating in cyberspace `` i see the basic infrastructure for this business is already there but i do n't see it being profitable so soon '' said patrick yau technology analyst at schroders securities ibm launched its virtual shopping mall called world avenue in the last quarter of 1996 and now has about 15 merchants signed on it gets a start-up fee from the vendors a five percent commission on sales and a monthly maintenance charge some critics say such a retailing concept does not add much value other than the convenience of shopping from home `` malls on the internet are not what people want '' said stan dolberg a forrester research analyst in a reuter report `` if they want a mall they want products grouped together by categories say like shoes so they can comparison shop ... the internet itself is like a whole mall where a lot of different things are already grouped together '' he said other recent internet shopping mall efforts have also failed like mci communications corp 's mci marketplace while ibm conceded it was too early to tell if its virtual mall would succeed it said one advantage was that people would be able to shop as and when they liked even when shops were closed `` we are thinking of doing a poll at one of the large malls to ask if people really enjoy shopping at the mall itself '' said patrick technologies in the pipeline ibm hopes to license a project called panoramix currently being tested which gives a three-dimensional experience be it in a shop or a museum the consumer can view products close up and effect a purchase through a simple point and click digital is demonstrating millicent a technology that allows low-value transactions credit card companies normally would not accept and the network computer which the industry is banking on to help boost electronic commerce will be rolled out from the first half of this year software company oracle corp champions the network computer -- a simple and cheap device that pulls data from a network -- as the way to get computer-shy people onto the net as it would look and work like a consumer device for instance a television set security and cost companies say hurdles like security bandwidth and regulation have already been crossed or would soon be resolved the major barrier is gaining people 's trust that it is safe to do business over the net ibm and digital say that with techniques such as encryption now available it is as safe if not safer to transact over the net than over the telephone at the end of the day the lure of electronic commerce is that it provides new ways of doing business at a lower cost `` small businesses will have a global reach which they could n't have before vendors can go directly to customers and cut out the middlemen '' said giordano businesses can exist without buildings and with fewer staff resulting in lower overheads inventory levels can be cut yau of schroders said banks would probably be the first to adopt electronic commerce in a big way as they were the ones who had the financial resources to invest in the technology analysts say electronic commerce will only really take off when people find the net as comfortable as using the telephone will a parallel economy emerge in cyberspace the debate goes on

management technologies inc said friday that as a result of an internal audit it has restated earnings for the first and second quarters of its fiscal year it also announced a loss in the current quarter for the first quarter ended july 31 1996 the company reported a net loss of 421,000 or 0.02 per share on total revenues of 6.762 million compared to a net loss of 2.155 million or 0.14 per share on total revenues of 6.266 million for the quarter ended july 31 1995 for the second quarter ended october 31 1996 the company reported a net loss of 1.118 million or 0.03 per share on total revenues of 6.258 million compared to a net loss of 2.552 million or 0.12 per share on total revenues of 4.514 million for the quarter ended october 31 1995 management technologies also reported its results friday for the third quarter the company said it posted a net loss of 1.235 million or 0.02 per share on total revenues of 4.287 million for the three months ended january 31 results for the same period in 1996 were a net loss of 791,000 or 0.04 per share on total revenues of 5.812 million management technologies specializes in the development implementation and support of international banking software and integrated trading room solutions

boeing co. friday appointed long-time executive richard pearson to head the commercial aircraft operations acquired in its purchase of mcdonnell douglas corp pearson who joined boeing in 1967 led the company 's commercial airplane group transition team in the seven months leading up to the 16.3 billion merger which became effective friday pearson eventually will move to california to oversee the douglas products division formerly known as douglas aircraft co. which makes the md-80 md-90 md-95 and md-11 airplanes at plants in orange county the long-term fate of those models is uncertain although boeing chairman phil condit said last week he saw potential for derivatives of the new md-95 that would be smaller than any plane the company currently offers walter orlowski who had served as president of douglas aircraft will move to seattle to become a vice president in boaing 's commercial airplane group boeing has not yet made any announcements about management of its defence and space operations which constitute the bulk of the assets acquired in the merger a company spokesman said `` no consensus '' was reached on whether the operations will be based in seattle or st. louis where fighter jets including the f-15 and f/a 18 are manufactured a reorganization also is possible alan mulally the recently appointed president of boeing 's defence and space operations is on vacation and will not take part in any of the `` day one '' celebrations planned for monday at 40 boeing sites across the country a spokesman said

canadian bond rating service said on tuesday that it had upgraded the rating outlook of canadian national railway company to positive and kept a b++ high investment rating on the company 's debentures and notes cbrs said the rating on cn 's pass-through certificates was one-notch higher at a low because of collateral value and the nature of assets `` the upgrade in the rating outlook reflects the significant operational improvements achieved by cn since its privatisation in 1995 '' cbrs said `` owing to the continued progress in cn 's operating characteristics and sound financial performance the company is poised to extend its earnings and cash flow in 1997 '' cbrs added paul simao reuters toronto bureau 416 941-8104

bema gold corp shares fell thursday after the company released exploration results from its cerro casale gold property in chile that disappointed investors analysts said bema shares were down 0.65 at 11.40 in toronto after bottoming at 11.10 they were off 1/2 at 8-3/8 on the american stock exchange analysts said investor expectations had soared in anticipation of further good news from bema but the announcement thursday did not bear out those high hopes `` the grades were rather mediocre much lower than they previously announced '' said one analyst who asked not to be identified added another analyst who also did not want to be identified `` the market was anticipating better results ... people were expecting something more '' but analysts said the new data did not detract from previously promising data at the property in northern chile and emphasized that exploration remains in its early stages bema owns 49 percent of cerro casale while arizona star resource corp in which bema is a major shareholder owns 51 percent arizona star stock lost 0.95 to 14.40 in vancouver the two companies released results from two drill holes among the results for various intervals they said hole 30 had a gold grade of 0.55 grams per tonne over a length of 251 meters hole 29 had a grade of 0.38 grams per tonne over 250 meters they said hole 30 `` indicates a substantial increase in the width of the main porphyry zone '' -- reuters vancouver bureau 604 664-7314

replenished kerosene stocks in japan deterred trading houses from stepping up kerosene imports towards winter the first heating season since imports of oil products were deregulated in april traders said on wednesday `` with domestic kerosene inventories this high it would be very difficult to find a buyer of import cargoes '' said one middle distillate trader with a trading house japan 's kerosene stocks had been substantially lower than year-earlier levels until july due to refiners policy of keeping inventories low as well as colder-than-usual weather last winter however kerosene inventories jumped at the end of august partly due to higher output by domestic refiners and this discouraged prospective importers at trading houses firmer spot kerosene import prices are another reason trading houses are thinking twice about importing with kerosene prices above 30.00 per barrel on a cost-and-freight basis imports would end up being more expensive than domestically processed kerosene traders said since the deregulation eight non-refiners mostly trading houses have acquired licences to import kerosene traders said importing gasoline kerosene and gas oil was formerly limited to domestic refiners

a recent flip-flop in indian aviation policy barring foreign airlines from taking stakes in the domestic sector sends worrisome signals about the pace of economic reform analysts and businessmen said on sunday prime minister h.d deve gowda 's crisis-ridden cabinet on tuesday prohibited foreign airlines from taking stakes in domestic ventures though it let other foreign investors in `` this decision will send out negative signals just as the government was doing fine on other economic fronts '' said v. raghuraman secretary-general of the associated chambers of commerce and industry assocham a direct casualty of the new rule is a proposed tie-up between india 's largest business group the tatas and singapore airlines to set up a 600 million domestic network `` it 's a case of india shooting itself in the foot very few airlines can stand alone nowadays a monopoly situation causes all sorts of inefficiencies '' said graham hayward executive director of the singapore international chamber of commerce the tatas planned to take a 60 percent stake in the airline and sia the rest according to a february 1995 proposal which the government sat on for two years it became the focus of a high-profile battle by civil aviation minister c.m ibrahim to protect state-run airlines air-india which operates on international routes and indian airlines which flies domestic routes `` i think it 's very sectoral they do n't want to liberalise the airline sector for whatever reason but that does n't mean that in other sectors they wo n't do that '' said dilip ratha senior economist at w.i carr stockbrokerage in singapore he said it would not make foreign investors more cautious about india because they were already very cautious india hopes to attract 10 billion in foreign direct investment annually over the next few years mainly to improve its overburdened infrastructure to support economic growth of around seven percent a year foreign direct investment approvals totalled 26.7 billion between august 1991 and december 1996 and in the nine months april to december 1996 the figure was only marginally up on the 1.5 billion for the same period a year earlier a strategist with a foreign investment bank said there were still grounds for hope that the civil aviation ministry will drop its objections to foreign airlines entering india 's market `` if one looks at it coolly it is probably just a short-term phenomenon the result of animosity between the industry minister and the civil aviation minister '' he said indian airlines is closer to moving into the black on friday it reported a 1996/97 net loss of 407.5 million rupees against a loss of 1.09 billion 1995/96 it forecast net profit in 1997/98 at 953 million rupees the cabinet also limited foreign firms that are not airlines to 40 percent equity stakes in domestic airlines the moves have radically affected jet airways india 's largest private airline in which two foreign airlines have stakes gulf air holdings and kuwait airways each have 20 percent stakes valued at 4 million in jet airways whose fleet of 12 aircraft operates 74 flights each day to 23 destinations jet airways would divest its foreign equity an airline official told reuters `` the policy decision has been taken we will also disinvest and go by the government requirements '' he said the government has fixed a six-month deadline for divestment no other country allowed international carriers to operate its domestic services said an aviation analyst who did not want to be named `` why should india be any different '' he asked india began opening its aviation sector to private enterprise under an economic liberalisation programme launched by then prime minister p.v narasimha rao in 1991 a dozen domestic airlines quickly sprang up but were winnowed down to a handful by crippling fuel and maintenance costs low occupancy rates and government laws that force them to fly to remote unprofitable regions last year the civil aviation ministry began reviewing policies governing foreign equity stakes in domestic airlines india 's creaking infrastructure has also slowed growth in air traffic

kansas city power light co said sunday that it continues to recommend that shareholders not tender their shares to western resources inc kcpl said that unless western determines to let its exchange offer terminate it will be required to extend its offer from time to time for a `` substantial '' period of time kcpl said that western 's offer has been open since july and that since then a little more than 40 percent of the company 's shares outstanding were tendered to western earlier on sunday western resources said that more than 44 percent of kcpl shares have been tendered and that it has extended its offer deadline to novemer 15 1996

news corp ltd chief executive and chairman rupert murdoch said in a newspaper interview published on friday that news was still on track for a 20 percent increase in profit in the current 1996/97 year `` if the american economy holds where it is and the british one does yes certainly the 20 percent increase is attainable '' murdoch told news corp 's courier mail newspaper in an interview news corp said after its 1995/96 results in late august that a 20 percent profit rise was very attainable `` but it is still early days to be saying that '' the newspaper quoted murdoch as saying

uk general insurance brokers will have to increase their investment in information technology to meet the competitive threat from direct telephone insurers in personal lines insurance `` general insurance brokers will be in for a tough time unless they harness technology to combat the threat from direct writers '' management consultancy datamonitor said in a report insurance brokers will spend 177 million stg on it this year rising to 199 million in 2001 datamonitor said in its report 'it in uk personal general insurance brokers will expand their use of call centres databases the internet and e-mail however by 2000 their share of personal general insurance will have fallen to 36 percent from 61 percent in 1995 it added the expansion of direct writers will lead to mergers acquisitions and some brokers withdrawing from the personal lines market for motor and household insurance brokers will have to respond to this trend by investing in direct distribution of policies over the telephone and the internet the report said -- reuters insurance news 44 171 542 2769

in a bid to draw a final curtain on the savings and loan crisis of the 1980s the house banking committee voted on thursday in favor of eliminating the federal charter for thrift institutions in a third day of debate on legislation to overhaul aging u.s. financial laws the committee rejected an amendment sponsored by rep. john lafalce democrat of new york and jack metcalf republican of washington to preserve the thrift charter provisions in the financial modernization legislation would force all thrifts to begin operating as banks although with some grandfathering of their currently authorized powers in a vote that crossed party lines the committee voted 26-23 to reject the amendment the committee then went on to consider an amendment sponsored by florida republican bill mccollum to lengthen the period under which thrifts would be allowed to operate under the grandfather provision the vote bolstered the chances for final passage of the legislation because the banking industry has said it would actively oppose the bill if the thrift charter was preserved bankers reluctantly backed the mccollum amendment `` it 's not ideal for us but we are willing to go along with it to defeat the lafalce amendment '' said ed yingling the top lobbyist for the american bankers association -- aaron pressman 202 898-8312

c.h heist corp said on wednesday it would delay the planned spin-off of its ablest service corp unit through initial public offering until later this year the company said market conditions were unfavorable for an ipo of its size based on the investment bank advice it decided to wait president c.h heist said `` ablest will continue to aggressively pursue acquisitions and open new offices in strategic markets where the company currently does not have a presence '' he said that should provide critical mass needed to complete an ipo on terms originally planned ablest is a temporary staffing company c.h heist corp provides industrial services including cleaning insulation and maintenance new york newsdesk 212-859-1610

ashland inc and usx-marathon group are close to signing a deal which would combine the companies refining and marketing operations the petroleum intelligence weekly said in its march 31 edition the deal would give marathon a controlling stake in ashland 's three refineries totalling 355,000 barrels per day of capacity and would give the combined company over 600,000 barrels per day of crude oil distillation capacity in the midwestern united states the report said the combined refining capacity of the two companies accounts for about six percent of total u.s. crude oil distillation capacity the report said neither company was immediately available to comment -- new york newsdesk 212-859-1610

united auto group inc said monday it had secured a 50 million revolving credit agreement from bank of nova scotia morgan guaranty trust co chase manhattan bank credit lyonnais and comerica inc it said the funds will be used to acquire automotive dealerships and for working capital marshall cogan who was recently named chairman and chief executive officer of united auto effective april 17 said the capital commitment enhances the company 's ability to acquire auto dealerships he said the company recently agreed to buy three new ford dealerships in the chattanooga tenn. and atlanta markets united auto operates 41 franchises in arizona arkansas connecticut georgia new jersey new york tennessee and texas

troubled slovenian financial consultancy dadas said on monday it was considering a merger with fellow consultancy primofin in the latest sign that the country 's financial sector is on the brink of a deep overhaul dadas said the proposal would be discussed at its shareholder 's meeting on november 29 both dadas and primofin declined to comment on the planned tie-up last week banks gorenjska and ubk announced they were in talks about a merger aimed at increasing their joint market share and cutting costs on friday listed dolenjska banka also said it was in talks with other banks about a possible tie-up slovenia which has a population of two million currently has 27 registered banks should the merger between the two financial consultancies take place each listed primofin share would be exchanged for four dadas shares while 2,000 unlisted primofin shares would be exchanged for 20 dadas shares each dadas said in a press release the merger would boost dadas equity currently 125.3 million tolars 907,971 by 62.4 million tolars `` dadas is probably trying to increase its capital and cut its operational costs with this move '' said davor dubokovic a trader at brokerage eastbrokers traders said dadas already owns between 40 and 50 percent of primofin shares `` dadas and primofin are two shares that are interesting only for investors who care just about short-term gains the two shares are very volatile '' said goran brankovic a trader at nova ljubljanska banka dadas faced serious problems at the end of march after the stock market 's watchdog pushed to prohibit dadas mutual fund proficia dadas from trading on alleged trading irregularities since march dadas share price has plunged 93 percent on monday dadas dropped 33 percent while primofin surged 75 percent on the news of a possible tie-up -- novica mihajlovic ljubljana newsroom 386-61-125-8439

poland 's privatisation ministry will sign a formal agreement with its advisor in the sale of the polar sa white goods maker by the end of the month privatisation minister wieslaw kaczmarek said on thursday in august poland picked a consortium of bank handlowy w warszawie sa and a polish consortium firm access to advise in the privatisation the state-owned polar said earlier this week it planned to offer more than 70 million zlotys worth of new stock to the public and to enter the warsaw bourse in the first half of 1997 the company which makes refrigerators freezers and washing machines said it would not seek a strategic investor in the near future but did not rule out an alliance with another renowned producer later -- warsaw newsroom +48 22 653 9700

tennessee gas pipeline co said wednesday it plans to form a joint venture with mcn investment corp to build a liquefied natural gas facility on the delmarva peninsula near delaware 's border with maryland the proposed 40 to 50 million project would provide liquefaction storage and vaporization services beginning in early 2000 according to tennessee gas the el paso energy corp subsidiary said it and the mcn energy group inc subsidiary would equally onw the venture continental states peaking services llc `` depending on the level of interest shown by potential customers in our open season this facility could provide between ome and two billion cubic feet equivalent of natural gas storage service which equates to peak-day withdrawal capacity of 100 to 200 million cubic feet per day of revaporized natural gas '' mcn investment chief executive rai bhargava said the planned facility would be directly connected to the eastern shore natural gas pipeline system with access to the williams cos inc 's transcontinental gas pipe line and columbia gas transmission systems several northeast satellite lng storage facilities also could be supplied by this facility mcn spokesman stewart lawrence said `` pipeline capacity into this region is severely constrained during the peak winter months but generally available in the warmer months noted john somerhalder president of tennessee gas pipeline `` the continental states facility will allow customers to store lower-cost gas in the market area and have it ready for reliable delivery when it 's needed most '' open season for the joint project begins at 0800 edt/1200 gmt june 18 and ends 1700 edt/2100 gmt july 25 the project 's size capacity and feasibility will be based on the open season results tennessee gas pointed out following the completion of a successful open season continental states plans to file for federal energy regulatory commission approval of the project -- new york newsdesk 212-859-1610

the u.s. justice department said thursday it has had `` talks '' with nationwide mutual insurance co. which has been accused of discriminating against minorities in selling homeowner policies in urban neighbourhoods `` we are engaged in talks with nationwide regarding allegations of discrimination '' spokeswoman lee douglass said in a telephone interview `` the talks have been constructive '' asked if a full-scale investigation is under way she said the department does not confirm or deny any investigations columbus ohio-based nationwide the sixth largest u.s. property/casualty insurer said it was reviewing its urban marketing strategy the company plans a news conference friday `` we are evaluating whether our underwriting guidelines constitute a barrier to our gaining market share in urban markets '' nationwide spokesman john millen said in a telephone interview late thursday a non-profit organisation the national fair housing alliance said nationwide makes it difficult or costly for homeowners in predominantly african-american hispanic or integrated urban neighbourhoods to insure their homes the group had homeowners in such neighbourhoods ask insurers for information then had owners of comparable homes in mostly white suburban neighbourhoods do the same `` our investigations have shown that nationwide has engaged in discrimination in several ways '' executive director shanna smith said in a telephone interview for example an urban home might cost two to three times as much to insure as its suburban counterpart in some areas nationwide would not insure homes valued at less than 60,000 or limit coverage on homes built before 1950 she said `` that had a greater impact on integrated and minority neighbourhoods '' since many urban homes are older and valued at less than similar suburban homes she said nationwide 's millen said its age and valuation guidelines were based on traditional industry standards nationwide insurance enterprise 's property and casualty companies including nationwide mutual are separate business units from a life insurance unit nationwide financial services inc. which plans a public offering of stock

at t corp said on wednesday that wireline services revenue grew three percent in the fourth quarter of 1996 to 11.54 billion while wireless services revenue grew 18.4 percent to 937 million for the quarter communications services revenue increased 529 million or 4.3 percent from the same period last year communications services revenues include wireline services wireless services as well as communications products and other services wireless subscribers grew 31.7 perent to 5.2 million from a year ago including 900,000 digital subscribers `` we remain committed to growing our core business investing wisely in the future and ultimately building long-term value for our owners '' said chairman robert allen at t said that one rate a flat 15 cents per minute long distance calling plan had been well received and was meeting at t 's expectation for reducing customer churn financial services had an operating loss of 4 million for the quarter compared with operating profit of 109 million a year ago revenues fell 32.3 percent from a year ago however this was an improvement from the third quarter 1996 when an operating loss of 35 million was recorded the improvement on the third quarter at the unit was due to lower costs with expenses falling 15 percent the fall in revenues was caused mainly by a securitization program begun in 1995 which almost doubled securitized receivables to 6.5 billion in 1996 total financial services receivables were 13.5 billion on 18.3 million customer accounts at the end of the fourth quarter revenues from communication products and other products which includes outsourcing and consulting online and wireless product sales were 17 percent up at 386 million in the quarter from a year ago nick louth new york newsroom 212 859 1712

two people were killed and several others were injured when a blast rocked a station of the regional express underground railway in paris on tuesday prime minister alain juppe told reporters juppe gave no estimate of the number of people injured by the explosion which occurred around 6.30 p.m. 1730 gmt at the port royal rer station on the left bank officials said earlier that 28 people were injured `` there are apparently two dead '' juppe said before leaving his office for the scene of the blast the blast took place in a carriage of the rer train `` we heard a strong blast '' one witness who was in a bus above the station told france-info radio `` there was a column of black smoke which enveloped the bus there was a strong smell of powder like at a shooting range '' the explosion occurred on the same line and two stations away from saint-michel station where a blast in july last year killed eight people and injured nearly 100 launching a wave of attacks across france by algerian moslem fundamentalists

closed escrow sales of california detached homes increased during september from a year ago but declined slightly from august according to a report released on friday the california association of realtors and transamerica 's metroscan real estate service said median home prices increased during september from a year ago in 152 of the more than 300 selected california cities and areas `` we have now seen one continuous year of statewide sales increases on a monthly basis compared with the year before '' said california association of realtors president rick snyder statewide 512,620 existing single-family detached homes closed escrow during september on a seasonally-adjusted annualized basis down 2.8 percent from a revised annualized rate of 527,460 homes sold in august the september sales pace jumped 12.2 percent from the september 1995 annualized rate when 456,920 homes were sold year-to-date statewide home sales have increased 23.2 percent compared with the january through september period in 1995 according to the report the statewide median price of an existing single-family detached home sold during september was 179,630 down 0.7 percent from 180,830 in august the september median price edged down 0.5 percent from september 1995 when the median-priced home sold for 180,530 the report said fixed mortgage interest rates averaged 8.23 percent during september up from an average of 7.95 percent in august and 7.61 percent in september 1995 according to the federal home loan mortgage corp. adjustable mortgage interest rates averaged 5.85 percent in september up slightly from 5.81 percent in august and 5.80 percent in september 1995

air france pilots drawing back from a showdown which might have forced the resignation of airline chairman christian blanc voted to delay a four-day strike scheduled to begin on sunday `` seventy percent of the pilots at the general assembly voted for a delay in the strike '' an air france spokeswoman said blanc had threatened to resign if the stoppage went ahead he had estimated the strike would cost one billion francs 175 million dashing his hopes of piloting air france to financial breakeven this year and an early privatisation the pilot 's decision was confirmed in a vote by union representatives geoffroy bouvet head of the snpl union said 21 delegates had approved a motion to delay the strike by two months seven opposed it and five abstained unions had called the strike from march 23 to 26 to protest against blanc 's plan to hire 450 younger pilots on lower wages blanc wants to cut the flight crew wage bill by 15 percent to bring it into line with its european and u.s. rivals as part of a three-year plan to boost competitiveness the company is under pressure to reduce costs with the european air travel market opening up to full competition next month air france had proposed to hire new pilots at a starting annual gross salary of 220,000 francs 38,500 compared to the start-up pay of 330,000 francs 57,800 that current pilots received when they began their careers according to french news reports the new starting wage is higher than those of lufthansa and british airways and nearly 40 percent above starting wages at american airlines snpl chief bouvet said blanc had agreed not to put the new wage scale into effect during the two-month postponement of the strike to allow discussions with the unions

franco-belgian relations more often than not a case of disdain meets schizophrenia have plumbed new depths with the sudden announcement last thursday of the closure of french carmaker renault 's belgian plant the belgian government is taking renault to court over the manner in which it announced the closure of what to make matters worse is a profitable car plant in belgian prime minister jean-luc dehaene 's home town `` the government is indignant and stupefied '' dehaene said after news of the closure `` this decision is unacceptable '' on tuesday the daily la derniere heure summed up the national mood and suggested a strategic retaliation `` there is only one answer to the financial terrorism of renault 's state shareholder boycott `` it said dehaene has appealed personally to his french counterpart alain juppe to intervene and reverse the closure decision but to date renault is standing by its decision it is not the first time france and belgium have come to diplomatic blows but in this case it is aggravated by the fact the plant is in the dutch-speaking flemish area of the country which has never shaken off its fear and loathing of the french french is the language of the southern walloon region of belgium which used to run the country but which is now a poor industrial wasteland in which some are increasingly looking to france for protection from their rich northern cousins at the same time french justice authorities are proving reluctant to cooperate with their belgian counterparts trying to investigate allegations that french aerospace firm dassault paid bribes to belgian political parties for contracts in the 1980s dassault has denied the allegations but belgium has issued an international arrest warrant for company chief serge dassault who risks arrest if he sets foot outside france belgian justice minister stefaan de clerck has personally asked for better cooperation from france and dehaene has said he too will step in unless matters improve the affair -- and the unrelated but contemporaneous bribery scandal involving italian helicopter firm agusta -- has already ended the careers of some senior belgian politicians it has also turned the francophone socialist party a member of the ruling coalition into what one government source recently termed `` a virtual party '' dassault 's reluctance to visit belgium follows the arrest of fellow countryman didier pineau-valencienne when he voluntarily turned up for questioning in 1994 over alleged fraud when his firm schneider took over some assets in belgium the diplomatic uproar over this arrest cooled when pineau-valencienne was freed after 12 days and allowed to return to france but it boiled again when he later refused to come back resulting in the issue of an international arrest warrant the matter was only sorted out in early 1995 when he struck a deal with the belgian authorities to come back to give more evidence on the understanding he would not be touched industrio-political rows are not the only ones to buffet the rocky franco-belgian relationship france was incensed when belgium despite intense lobbying to at least stay neutral joined in the international condemnation of its resumed south pacific nuclear tests in 1995 it is a feeling of betrayal that president jacques chirac who had used the tests to stamp his personality on his new presidency will be slow to forget france and belgium have also clashed over their mutual border which under the schengen agreement is supposed to be completely open but on which france reimposed checks in a bid to stem the flow of drugs it says originates in the netherlands the checks were reinforced when the algerian fundamentalist bombing campaign began but the belgians remain deeply unhappy at what they see as the cavalier attitude of their big brother neighbour all this is happening at a time when france and belgium are bidding to be the first to leap into the european union 's single currency bed and are negotiating a common european justice area to enhance cross-border judicial cooperation

fai insurances ltd expects profits to continue to grow in the future fai director and chief financial officer timothy mainprize said at a roadshow in singapore on wednesday `` our profits will continue to improve over the next few years '' mainprize told potential investors in the insurance company 's recently announced us 75 million floating rate note in february chief executive rodney adler said in a statement the company should maintain profit growth in the absence of abnormal events in the insurance field the company 's net profit for the first half ended december 31 rose by 35.4 percent to australian 7.7 million mainprize noted the company 's claims paying ability was upgraded by standard and poor 's corp last october to an investment-grade bbb-minus `` we are reasonably confident that we shall be upgraded up again '' he said he said fai was talking with a large u.s. insurer -- which he did not identify -- about the possibility of entering into an agreement to market information technology insurance

the world 's second longest suspension bridge is due to be officially opened this weekend amid concern among hong kong 's air cargo industry about the `` unthinkable '' industry sources told reuters the hk 7.1 billion eight lane double-deck road and rail bridge is the spectacular centre piece of the lantau link which includes two other bridges and viaducts it will open for traffic on may 22 it is the only land connection between the territory 's new chek lap kok airport off lantau island and the rest of hong kong industry sources fear if the link were ever cut the airport would be paralysed and hong kong 's economy immediately affected cargo sources said last year 's channel tunnel fire showed how disaster can easily strike and cause months of chaos for cargo operators security concerns at the new bridge were raised earlier this week when electrical wires were cut in 32 places already tight security has been strengthened according to officials a barge derrick crashing into a nearby bridge last year also raised safety concerns a hong kong government spokesman said the chances of the bridge ever having to close were `` very very remote '' he said it was typhoon-proof and road traffic could switch to the enclosed lower deck but said `` unforeseen things can happen '' a private company has been given the contract to ensure traffic flows smoothly along the entire tsing ma control area he added in the event of the `` worst case scenario '' with a total bridge closure the spokesman said contingency measures are being drawn up for passenger ferries to be requisitioned and replace the express rail service which will also use the bridge as yet there are no provisions for cargo handling `` if the worst comes to the worst passengers are the priority we have no contingency plan for cargo yet '' he said in an interview with hong kong handling record amounts of cargo up to 5,700 tonnes in one day it is doubtful whether any contingency measures would be able to handle just a fraction of the daily total industry sources said yeung kwok keung deputy managing director of hong kong air cargo terminals ltd which will operate the superterminal one air cargo terminal at chek lap kok said this week 's wire cutting sabotage had been helpful in raising security concerns `` it does not bear thinking about that the airport operation will be reliant on anything other than the bridge link if in the unlikely unwelcome and unfortunate event of the link being cut off and with the sea-based contingency plan in operation i have no doubt whatsoever that the impact on flight movements will be very significant '' yeung told reuters with thousands of consignments being handled every day the terminal would quickly clog up with incoming cargo and run out of storage space aircraft bound for hong kong would then have to be turned away and departing flights could leave empty yeung said `` the cargo industry has to look at and consider the likely impact on their trade of such a long cut off and it is something which we will be looking at it is a general concern but we are not terrified as yet at the prospect of such a disconnection because we do believe that the possibility is low to the extreme '' yeung added an airline operators committee source which represents all airlines airport managers and ground handling managers said he is also concerned `` i believe the issue is so important not just for airlines air freight forwarders but for the hong kong economy as a whole that some contingency measures should be drawn up '' he added at 1,377 metres long it is the world 's second longest suspension bridge after the humber bridge in england according to the new airport projects coordination office former british prime minister lady thatcher will officiate at this week 's opening ceremony

canada 's eldorado gold corp ltd said on tuesday that a proposed 193.6 million deal with south africa 's gencor ltd had been called off due to market conditions `` ... due to current market conditions eldorado and gencor ltd have been unable to satisfactorily renegotiate the proposed transaction previously announced on june 5 1997 '' eldorado said in a statement `` as a result the proposed transaction will not proceed '' it added gencor announced june 5 that it had signed a memorandum of understanding with eldorado gold corp in terms of which eldorado would acquire a portfolio of mining and development and exploration assets in ghana and south africa in a deal valued at 193.6 million an eldorado spokesman told reuters current market conditions referred mainly to the recent weakness in the gold price gold fell to a 12-year low of 314 an ounce in early july and has made little progress beyond 330 since then it was trading at around 323 an ounce in late london trade on tuesday gencor declined to comment on the announcement and said a statement would be released on wednesday eldorado said it would continue to develop its ongoing relationship with the new gencor ltd gencor recently split itself into base metals arm billiton plc and a gold company gencor ltd -- eldorado 's largest shareholder `` eldorado intends to concentrate its activities on its present operations development projects and priority exploration properties '' the company added -- johannesburg newsroom +27 11 482-1003 e-mail johannesburg.newsroom reuters.com

british pop superstars oasis rocked by rumours of a split told anxious fans on tuesday they would release a new album next year after abruptly pulling out of a concert tour of the united states last week the million-selling band said it would start work on their long-awaited third album next month when their tour collapsed amid reports that singer liam gallagher and his guitarist brother noel had come to blows their record company denied reports oasis would split but confirmed they would not be touring for the foreseeable future the oasis story caused a furore in the british media obsessed with the most popular british band since the beatles split up in 1970 liam once boasted `` we are bigger than jesus we will be as big as the beatles if not bigger '' in their latest statement oasis denied reports of internal differences disappointing ticket sales in the u.s. and suggestions that liam 's girlfriend was breaking up the band `` the reason for the premature return of the band has nothing to do with recent uk tabloid hysteria eg poor ticket sales liam 's fiancee patsy kensit sibling rivalry or internal differences '' the statement said `` it was a decision taken solely by noel gallagher on behalf of his four friends we look forward to presenting our fans with a new album in the summer of '97 '' oasis whose first two albums have sold 20 million copies have led a `` britpop '' revival a summer concert drew a record crowd of 250,000 but the feuding between the gallagher brothers has generated as many headlines as the music oasis 's record company creation is 49 percent owned by sony music

the future of a popular tourist spot -- the bureau of engraving and printing plant near the mall -- as well as vast potential cost savings are at stake in the fight over a new u.s. 1 coin `` eliminating the one-dollar note could substantially reduce and possibly eliminate the need for a washington d.c. production plant '' the general accounting office said thursday in a look at coinage and money-printing operations bill printing could be consolidated in fort worth texas if a 1 coin were issued in place of the note gao officials said they said the bureau preferred to have a back-up plant but had not decided whether to replace the washington plant the bureau of engraving and printing says 700,000 people a year visit the plant which prints bills in denominations from 1 to 100 members of a house banking subcommittee were skeptical a 1 coin would be a success given the lackluster record of the susan b. anthony dollar coin nor were some of them ready to stop producing the 1 bill a key premise in gao 's estimate that the 1 coin would save 456 million a year in costs coins can last 30 years but paper notes must be replaced every 16 months at government expense `` these are not false savings '' said michael motley gao associate director for government business operations who said other nations successfully converted to coins `` well fine you run on that platform '' retorted rep. joe kennedy a massachusetts democrat public acceptance of a 1 coin could rise motley said if it had a distinctive color or if a new design was adopted the anthony coin honoring the women 's sufferage leader was faulted as too similar in size and appearance to the 25-cent coin the u.s. mint no longer produces the anthony dollar but has a three-year supply stockpiled it estimates it would take 30 months to develop and begin production of a new 1 coin if congress ordered it gao said the mint could resume production of the anthony dollar if supplies ran out and a new 1 coin was not ordered but rep. floyd flake new york democrat said paper notes were lighter and easier to carry than 1 coins he was not mollified by a suggestion that more 2 bills could be printed if a 1 coin was mandated `` it 's a pain in the butt to carry all those coins in your pocket '' flake said in the past five years the 1 bill accounted for 47 percent of notes produced by the bureau of engraving and printing it could cost 73 million to gear up to produce a 1 coin according to the mint a new bill-printing plant could cost from 158 million to 250 million

pakistani prime minister nawaz sharif increased government support prices for wheat rice and oilseeds in a package announced on thursday aimed at boosting output he told a national farmers convention in islamabad his six-week-old government would announce more incentives for agriculture in the next few days with the aim to make pakistan self-sufficient in food for now sharif said the government 's support prices to be paid to farmers for a unit of 40 kg had been increased for wheat by nearly 30 percent to 240 rupees 5.97 from 185 rupees and by 25 percent for irri varieties of rice the support price for canola oilseed had been increased 12.5 percent to 450 rupees from 400 rupees per 40 kg and for sunflower about 17 percent to 450 rupees from 385 he said the package which includes concessions in the price of some agricultural inputs and promises of better credit follows economic reform measures announced by sharif last friday that slashed taxes and import tariffs the government says it plans to announce more measures to revamp and cut back state corporations reform banking and capital markets and promote investment thursday 's package abolished sales tax on government-certified seeds promised a cut in duties on locally made tractors and other agricultural machinery and reduced import duty on used and reconditioned harvesters to 10 percent from 35 percent sharif said he wanted to see pakistan self-sufficient in foodgrains within two years and declared fiscal 1997/98 july-june as a `` grow more wheat year '' `` is it not shameful that a country having vast fertile land area the world 's best irrigation system good weather conditions and strong and hard-working hands has to import wheat worth 25 billion rupees 622 million every year '' he asked he said pakistan was annually importing oilseeds worth 30 billion rupees lentils costing three billion rupees and also sugar after being self-sufficient in the commodity for years `` the cotton crop was a pride for us but now we are forced to import cotton as well '' he added '' food and agriculture minister abida hussain in her speech attributed pakistani agriculture 's `` bleak scenario '' to small land holdings soil erosion productivity constraints water loss transfer of resources to other sectors and shifts of population from villages to cities

kinark corp said monday it had filed with the securities and exchange commission a registration statement to offer common stock to its shareholders at about 3 per share it said it would make the offer to holders of record on september 27 1996 in june kinark said it had filed with the commission for rights to offer up to 4.8 million common shares to its shareholders in order to finance the purchase stock in rogers galvanizing co

gulf canada resources ltd plans to sell a major northern alberta oil and gas property it acquired last year to fund the paydown of stampeder exploration ltd 's debt gulf chief executive j.p. bryan said on monday bryan said he believed the property which pumps out about 12,500 barrels of oil equivalent a day could fetch between c 350 million and c 400 million the sale and gulf 's planned public offering of its indonesia assets provide enough cash to pay down debt to a level where gulf 's credit could be investment grade he said stampeder target of a c 1 billion friendly takeover by gulf has long-term debt of about c 300 million `` when we do the asamera transaction we anticipate taking another c 400-500 million off our canadian debt and bringing it down below c 2 billion '' bryan said `` so we think that based on cash flow multiples debt-to-equity will be in a very comfortable range and remove once and for all the conversation about our balance sheet we should definitely be inverstment grade at that point in time '' gulf made a major purchase last year from pennzoil co last year to beef up its land position at zama/virgo it plans to market the offering of the gulf indonesia resources ltd formerly asamera through september bryan said the gulf share issue tied to the stampeder purchase would increase its number of shares outstanding by about 25 percent but he said he expected the effects of the dilution would be reduced by several opportunities within stampeder 's asset base besides heavy oil which would be folded into gulf 's heavy oil sands assets to form a new public company that could acquire more heavy oil assets worldwide stampeder 's oil and gas marketing assets would also fit nicely with gulf 's own he said he also said gulf could blend stampeder 's light oil production to its heavy oil to reduce the effects of current wide light-heavy spreads bryan said gulf was paying between c 5 and c 5.50 per barrel of oil equivalent for its stampeder 's oil and gas reserves those totalled 98 million barrels of proven reserves and 143 million barrels of proven and probable reserves at the end of 1996 he also said the price represented just under five times stampeder 's expected 1998 cash flow stampeder 's production in the first quarter was about 32,000 barrels of oil equivalent a day indluding 25,000 barrels of oil and liquids and 75 million cubic feet of gas a day jeffrey jones reuters calgary bureau 403 531-1624

south korea 's daewoo electronics chairman bae soon-hoon wants to know the `` real reason '' behind the french government 's decision to suspend the sale of electronics group thomson sa a company spokesman said on thursday `` we are trying to find out the real reason behind the french government 's announcement of temporarily suspending the privatisation process '' spokesman park sung-il quoted the chairman as saying `` we 'll closely examine and confront any development to the situation '' the daewoo chairman added `` we do n't know yet what the french government 's position is from the information we 've received so far but it 's difficult to conclude that the privatisation plan has been put off completely '' bae said he said considering the french government 's international credibility daewoo electronics plan to take over thomson multimedia was unlikely to face too big a change the french government said on wednesday the suspension of the proposed thomson sell-off to lagardere groupe was due to objections to the planned sale of the company 's consumer electronics unit to daewoo several thousand workers of thomson multimedia marched in paris and other cities on november 20 to protest against the sale fearing for their jobs and working conditions -- seoul newsroom 822 727 5643

spain 's repsol is expected to post flat to weaker first quarter profits this week with good performances from all business divisions except for gas which will weigh on overall results analysts said on monday they forecast net attributable profit at between 33 and 36 billion pesetas in the first quarter versus 35.41 billion pesetas in the first quarter of 1996 operating profit is expected to do better rising to 60 billion pesetas at most versus 53.12 billion pesetas in the year-ago period at the core level profits will be boosted by what may be up to triple the level of earnings in the exploration and production division boosted by a stronger dollar versus the peseta an increase in the price of crude increased production and the incorporation of the purchase of astra one analyst at a spanish bank said `` exploration and production will see improvements on the back of a stronger dollar and a rise in the price of crude but also because repsol are now operating in more fields '' refining and marketing may see earnings increase 10 to 25 percent because of peru 's pampilla refinery coming on-stream and fatter refining margins analysts said but thinner marketing margins may offset part of these effects some warned the chemical division should see a comeback of up to 25 percent with product prices recovering after a lacklustre performance during the whole of 1996 they added `` prices have recovered and there 's also been capacity increases so we should see the positive effects of that '' said lucia granda analyst at beta capital the gas division may post a 30-40 percent drop in results analysts said after a particularly mild winter affected consumption heavily repsol 's 45 percent-owned subsidiary gas natural said on friday its first quarter profit fell nearly five percent at the end of the first quarter but some analysts expressed concern that gas results will have also been dulled by lower margins and not just lower consumption repsol will likely announce first quarter results on tuesday may 13 or on wednesday may 14 -- elisabeth o'leary madrid newsroom +341 585 2160

european union energy ministers failed on tuesday to find a formula for the liberalisation of the eu gas market but the dutch chairman of the energy council said he still hoped he could broker a deal next month the dutch who hold the eu presidency until june 30 had proposed a compromise on the three major obstacles to a deal on liberalisation -- how to structure market opening how to treat long term take-or-pay contracts and what exemptions from competition rules to allow emerging markets and regions but while ministers succeeded in narrowing their differences too many difficulties remained for an agreement on any of these crucial issues dutch economic affairs minister hans wijers told a news conference after the meeting he would consult individual eu states during the week before deciding whether there was enough convergence of views to try for a ministerial accord on june 24 chances of a deal before luxembourg took over the eu presidency on july 1 were `` fifty-fifty '' he said eu officials said a consensus appeared to be emerging around a two-tier formula for progressively liberalising national gas markets although no one is prepared yet to talk figures the formula allows certain `` eligible customers '' -- electricity generators and large industrial customers who consume more that a set amount of gas a year -- to negotiate contracts directly with the gas supplier of their choice it also sets an obligatory minimum level of liberalisation and an optional maximum ceiling eu energy commissioner christos papoutsis insisted at the meeting that over the next 10 years the consumption threshold should be lowered to increase the numbers of eligible customers while the minimum and maximum percentages of market opening should be increased but a deal will only be possible if the commissioner can overcome the reticence of the french who want the minimum- maximum percentages to remain unchanged and other member states led by the dutch who do not want to alter the threshold for eligible customers divisions also remain about who will be responsible for authorising restrictions on market access for new suppliers in cases where introducing competition would cause a crisis for distributors locked into long term take-or-pay contracts with suppliers in russia algeria and norway the commission insists the final say on future take-or-pay contracts should rest with the eu authorities in brussels a view backed by the dutch the british the danish and the finns but other member states particularly germany are arguing strongly for power to remain with national authorities whatever the outcome ministers will still have to set strict rules for allowing derogations ministers did manage to agree in principle that the emerging portuguese and greek gas markets should be given temporary derogations from competition rules but there was no accord on emerging regions in other member states over the next few weeks national governments will be asked to submit to the commission a list of isolated or undeveloped regions for which they want derogations in the meantime commisison officials will endeavour to draw up strict eligibility criteria

pakistani textile stocks have soared in the last two trading sessions in anticipation of a government relief package but analysts said on wednesday they saw no major turnaround in their earnings `` there has been an unprecedented rise in textile stocks in the last two trading sessions on the news that the government plans a relief package but people have over-reacted '' ing baring securities analyst amir paracha said baring 's daily preview said the all pakistan textile mills association aptma had urged the new caretaker government of prime minister meraj khalid to remove import charges on raw cotton and lower duties on the import of synthetic fibre ather rauf of carr mashriq said other demands of mill owners included a ban on cotton exports rescheduling loan repayments by troubled textile companies and concessions on utilities `` but most of these demands are economically unviable and if some are accepted even then we do not see any turnaround in textile companies '' he said rauf said the government 's textile reform package could be good for the economy as more than 60 percent of pakistan 's exports were cotton-based `` but we do not expect a turnaround in textile companies '' abid naqvi research chief at taurus securities said the government relief package would be in phases `` initially it will concentrate on the spinning sector and with time relief for value added sectors would be provided '' dealers said one reform package could not pull the textile companies out of trouble while most of them had years of accumulated losses naqvi said investors should take positions only in stocks with good track records and strong earning potential `` we recommend gadoon textiles and nishat mills which are trading at attractive earning levels '' he said `` the recovery of the textile sector will be a long process another taurus securities dealer zaina nowsherwan said `` most companies have five to six years of accumulated losses they can not bounce back in one year because of a single package '' she said most textile companies had not paid any dividend to

british commodity group ed f man group plc made the top bid for a slice of the privatised ivory coast sugar firm sodesucre the public opening of bids revealed on wednesday the privatisation committee held the open session to ensure transparency an official said final results were likely `` within 10 days '' sodesucre which produces and sells sugar and is 100 percent owned by the state is being split into two lots each comprising two production plants plus their plantations companies were invited to bid for a 55 percent stake in each lot the state will retain 20 percent employees will take five percent and the balance of 20 percent will be floated on the abidjan stock exchange the biggest bid for lot a comprising two sites in the northwest of the country near ferkessedougo came from a group comprising ed f man and britain 's commonwealth development corporation it valued the lot at 14.6 billion cfa francs 25 million after a deduction for debt the consortium put in a bid of 6.4 billion for a 55 percent stake lot b comprised one plant in borotou in the northwest plus one in zuenoula in the centre the committee received two practically identical bids for this lot sifca a private ivorian company valued it at 27 billion cfa francs and said that after debt that translated into an offer of 13.789 billion cfa francs for a 55 percent stake a senegalese company cie sucriere senegalaise also valued the lot at 27 billion cfa francs but its offer for the 55 percent stake came in at a tiny but possibly significant 500,000 cfa francs less the final decision of the committee will take into account any conditions attached to bids most of the bids read out appeared to commit bidders to take on all or most of the staff currently employed by sodesucre 585 cfa francs

j.p. morgan said on tuesday it started coverage of diversified financial services company transamerica corp with a market perform rating and a 12-month price target of 107 per share -- analyst michelle giordano said in a research note that market conditions in several of its businesses were `` less than optimal '' because of competition absence of significant demand and an unfavorable interest rate environment -- `` we see near-term earnings uncertainty caused by the start-up nature of its centralized consumer finance operations and weak leasing market conditions '' she said -- but giordano said share buybacks were likely to mitigate downside risk for the stock short-term -- transamerica stock lost 3/16 to 98-5/8 wall street desk 212-859-1730

from now on jenny craig inc. must warn consumers its weight loss methods are usually only temporary the federal government said thursday the provision is one of several announced by the federal trade commission settling deceptive advertising charges brought against the weight loss company in 1993 claims in most ads will have to include the statement `` for many dieters weight loss is temporary '' jenny craig will also have to disclose the average weight loss maintenance for consumers the commission said the government agency also focused on testimonials based on experiences atypical of most jenny craig clients testimonials about highly successful maintenance of weight loss must now be accompanied by the phrase `` this result is not typical you may be less successful '' in the past some ads suggested dieters could lose all the weight they wanted for 49 although the actual costs could run into hundreds of dollars jenny craig must end that practice the commission said in a statement jenny craig said `` the consent agreement does not suggest the company violated any law or regulation and it does not involve payment by the company of any financial damages '' but jenny craig faces civil penalties of up to 11,000 per day if it fails to live up to its promises ftc spokeswoman bonnie jansen said jenny craig president c. joseph labonte said `` after nearly six years of discussions we 're pleased to put this matter behind us '' but apparently the settlement could have been reached years ago ftc spokeswoman jansen noted that similar settlements were reached in 1993 with three other weight loss companies jenny craig did not settle and charges were filed while the consent agreement itself makes no comment about the company 's past practices jansen noted that it settles charges of deceptive advertising `` jenny craig has agreed not to misrepresent the performance safety or customer endorsement of any weight loss programme and to have scientific data to back up future claims '' the ftc said the ftc vote was 4-0 the public will have 60 days to comment to the ftc office of the secretary 6th and pennsylvania ave. nw washington dc 20580 the public can also reach the ftc through the world wide web at http //www.ftc.gov similar charges against weight watchers were pulled from litigation a week ago pending the possibility of a settlement with the ftc

carolina power light co was enlisting help thursday from across the south to help it cope with what looks like an inevitable tangle of downed lines and trees as hurricane fran takes aim at the carolinas `` if the hurricane follows its current track we are the main utility in its way '' said carolina power spokeswoman sally ramey `` it 's a huge storm '' `` we have been in close contact with the national weather service and are expecting winds perhaps as strong as 125-140 miles per hour mph as it hits the coast '' she said `` the damage we are expecting is potentially much more than bertha in july '' ramey said referring to the hurricane that quickly brushed along north carolina 's coast in july `` but fran is a slow-moving storm so we may not be able to start assessing damage until late friday and probably wo n't know the full extent of it until sometime saturday because of the high winds and rain '' said ramey bertha at its peak left 225,000 of carolina power 's 1.1 million customers without power that customer base represents over three million residents in the carolinas most of them in central and eastern north carolina most at risk during the storm is carolina power 's 5,867 miles of transmission lines the high-voltage lines carrying power from generating facilities to local distribution networks and the neighborhood distribution lines themselves earlier thursday the company said it had shut down its 1,521 megawatt mw brunswick nuclear power facility in southport n.c. a site near north carolina 's southernmost and quite close to fran 's current path ramey said that despite the shutdown they saw no problems meeting demand which was estimated to peak today at only 7,000 mw because of cloud cover ahead of fran compared with about 9,000 mw during a typical hot summer day -- new york power desk 212 859 1621

dry soil conditions in the last month before australia 's barley harvest may reduce output and raise world feed and malt barley prices the canadian wheat board 's director of weather and crop surveillance said `` if the australian barley crop is at all reduced it 'll have a big impact on us both in terms of feeding and malting barley because they 're a major competitor for us '' the cwb 's paul bullock said at manitoba pool elevators annual meeting the cwb reduced its world feed barley price forecast by c 7 a tonne last month to the c 143- 163 a tonne in benchmark no1 canada western feed barley what pressured prices in the past month was a larger world coarse grain production estimate by the international grains council on oct 24 at 875 million tonnes and the european union 's resumption of export subsidies last month but a reduction in australia 's output may buoy prices the australian wheat forecasters firm on oct 21 said it expected australian barley production from the current harvest at 6.14 million tonnes but the cwb 's bullock said he expects 6.0 million tonnes southern australia received half of its normal rainfall amounts in the last month bullock said `` victoria and south australia is where the big barley growing areas are that harvest which just started it 's these next three four weeks that 's going to make or break it '' bullock told reporters after a speech to mpe delegates `` it 's been dry and that may cut into the yields but that 's positive for quality if it stays that way '' he added rainfall in australia 's wheat belt was normal to above normal and bullock concurred with the u.s. department of agriculture 's nov 12 output estimate of 21 million tonnes -- gilbert le gras 204 947 3548

motorola inc said wednesday it still expects a modest improvement in the worldwide semiconductor industry in 1997 but now sees growth of about six to eight percent versus 1996 in a conference call with analysts motorola said it reduced its industry growth forecast from the 10 percent it estimated after the company 's first quarter ed gams head of motorola 's investor relations said the united states and asian regions are the strongest but less semiconductor industry growth is seen in japan where the market is affected by the strong u.s. dollar gams said the pullback in the company 's estimate is due in part to the effect of the strong dollar translating foreign sales into u.s. dollars reduces the overall growth rate he said industry growth in chips used in communications and automotive applications will be double-digit but the company expects all other sectors to show single-digit growth late tuesday motorola reported second quarter net earnings of 0.44 a share versus 0.54 a share last year excluding a 170 million pretax charge for its exit of the struggling dynamic random access memory dram business earnings were 0.62 a share easily beating the analysts consensus estimate of 0.56 a share according to first call in its semiconductor division motorola reported sales were up 12 percent versus the first quarter and orders rose 18 percent gams said semiconductor prices were generally stable and it is reasonable to expect its segment 's operating margins will improve motorola 's percentage interest in iridium llc which plans a global satellite-based telecommunications network has decreased to about 21 percent from 24 percent as other investors entered the the consortium twelve of the planned 66 satellites are already in orbit and are performing well gams said and another five were launched today `` motorola expects to record an expense of approximately 65 million in 1997 in recognition of its share of iridium llc 's net loss for the year '' gams said adding the expense will be concentrated in the second half of the year and is due largely to depreciation of launched satellites `` in 1998 motorola expects to record a level of expense recognition of its share of iridium llc losses that is several times greater than the 65 million expected in 1997 '' he said gams said that in 1999 and beyond however motorola expects to recognize few or no iridium losses as motorola writes down its equity investment in iridium the pager group is continuing to be hit by tight inventory controls by paging operators gams said and motorola expects that will continue into 1998 second quarter pager and sales orders were significantly lower than last year it said -- chicago newsdesk 312-408-8787

india is expected to have nearly 750,000 mobile phone users by the end of 1997 more than triple the 260,000 users at the end of 1996 a senior official of nokia pvt ltd a unit of finland 's nokia oy said on monday `` our prediction is that the indian market will add 500,000 to 550,000 users in 1997 and will stand at about 750,000 by the end of the year '' parikshit bhasin joint managing director nokia pvt ltd told reuters after a news conference he said the market had received a boost with mobile phone services having started in india 's regional telephone zones increased sales of handsets in large cities and a fall in the number of smuggled handsets had also aided the trend he said mobile phones debuted in india in october 1995 in four cities -- delhi bombay madras and calcutta -- following an auction of cellular service licences by the government in 1992 regional licences for other zones were auctioned in 1995 and services began in most regions early this year bhasin said the key growth centres were still the four large cities where cellular phones had become a business tool and demand was steadily increasing he added nokia expected similar growth in the regions in the second quarter of 1998 meanwhile handset vendors had cut prices to smother the temptation of going for smuggled goods bhasin said `` last year nokia launched its 1610 model at 20,000 rupees 558.65 and its 8110 model at 42,000 rupees today the 1610 costs 13,000 rupees and the 8110 30,000 rupees '' he said bhasin said nearly 80 percent of all mobile phones available in india were priced below 15,000 rupees bhasin was speaking after the launch of nokia 's latest handphone 3810 which costs 18,125 rupees and has been specially designed for asia-pacific consumers -- sanjit singh new delhi newsroom 91 11-301-2024 fax 91 11-301-4043
