automakers ended a strong 1996 with a whimper friday as general motors corp. said december u.s. car and truck sales fell nearly 14 percent and chrysler corp. managed a 1.1 percent sales gain for the month chrysler 's full-year sales of 2.45 million vehicles however broke the company 's 1988 record and the industry stayed on track to report full-year sales of 15.1 million cars and light trucks matching the 1994 total that was also its best year since 1988 automakers sold about 14.8 million cars and light trucks in the united states in 1995 `` it was a pretty good year as a whole but it 's closing on a soft note '' burnham securities analyst david healy said december sales from the 14 automakers who reported friday ran 8.6 percent below the year-ago results but full-year sales were up 1.8 percent analysts predicted that the seasonally adjusted annual sales rate for the month would be about 14.5 million to 14.8 million units compared with a strong december 1995 rate of 15.9 million units several japanese automakers also reported december sales declines on friday ford motor co. and honda motor co. ltd. are set to release year-end sales results on monday gm 's car sales fell 12.5 percent in december and normally stronger sales of gm trucks also fell a sharp 15.6 percent the december declines brought the auto giant 's full-year 1996 vehicle sales to 4,793,169 cars and trucks a 2.7 percent decline from the 4,895,368 units sold in 1995 gm 's sales for the year were marred by strikes that disrupted production in march late october and early november but analysts said car model changeovers and stiff competition in trucks also took a toll `` i think we 're past the point where you can use the strikes as an excuse '' healy said `` i think ford and chrysler are beginning to hurt gm in the truck area where its products are n't fresh any more '' still gm said truck sales for the full year exceeded 2 million units for the first time rising 2.8 percent over 1995 gm marketing chief ronald zarrella predicted gains in both cars and trucks in 1997 fueled by new sedans minivans and increased sport/utility vehicle producion `` the positive reception our new-for-'97 models are receiveing from both our dealers and customers is a certain sign that the coming year will be a good one for general motors and its dealers '' zarrella said in a statement gm 's market share has hovered near 30 percent in recent months continuing a steady decline over the past decade by contrast chrysler estimates that its market share increased by nearly 2 percentage points to nearly 16 percent bolstered by strong sales of minivans pickup trucks and sport/utility vehicles chrysler said its 1996 sales totaled 2,450,826 vehicles up 13 percent from 1995 's 2,164,343 it broke the previous annual record of 2,208,057 units set in 1988 chrysler said december sales of north american-built vehicles rose 5.4 percent but light truck sales dipped 0.2 percent in the month for the full year chrysler 's domestic car sales rose 6.6 percent to 827,941 units while light truck sales rose 16.7 percent 1,618,193 chrysler 's executive vice president of sales james holden said chrysler may have difficulty surpassing 1996 results this year in some months due to model changeovers he said the industry will still need incentives to maintain its sales pace `` i do n't see a way to wean ourselves completely from rebates and incentives but i expect to hold them to similar levels to what we 've had which have been relatively modest '' chrysler stock rose 50 cents to 34.625 while gm fell 62.5 cents to close at 57.875 both on the new york stock exchange among japanese automakers toyota motor corp. said december sales fell 17.4 percent while full-year sales rose 6.4 percent to 1.16 million units nissan motor corp. 's december sales dipped 0.2 percent and full-year sales fell 3.4 percent to 749,763 units mazda motor corp. 's december total was off 17.2 percent while annual sales fell 16.6 percent to 238,285 units germany 's volkswagen ag posted its best u.s. sales year since 1990 with sales up 17.3 percent to 135,907 cars and trucks december sales jumped 23.5 percent

time warner inc will tell its major shareholders this week that it plans to reduce its investment in the cable business as part of its efforts to cut down on its debt the wall street journal reported monday the newspaper said the company wants to reduce its interest in cable even if it is unable to reach an agreement with us west communications group which owns 25 percent of time warner entertainment the unit includes time warner cable the country 's second largest cable company with more than 11 million subscribers `` there are things we can do to lighten up cable without us west '' it quoted an unidentified senior company executive as saying the newspaper said time warner could either sell its interest in the cable systems that did not belong to its partnership with us west or spin them off completely

argentine bonds put in a strong performance monday helped by general flows into the latin american region although activity was still fairly slim `` the market rose with the whole region '' said a trader at a large foreign bank the market began to rise last week after several u.s. indicators showed moderating u.s. growth with market friendly argentine indicators released late friday and this session bonds were given an additional boost argentina 's frb due 2005 rose 3/4 to 83-6/8 while the local dollar-denominated bocon previsional 2 due 2001 rose 0.55 to 119.90 the economy ministry said monday consumer prices rose 0.5 percent in october from the previous month compared with 0.3 percent in october 1995 and 0.2 percent in september this year wholesale prices were up 0.5 percent compared with 0.2 percent in october last year and 1.2 percent a month earlier another trader said the market `` looks attractive at these levels '' before the gains in the market at the end of last week argentine bonds slumped for about 10 days as many investors booked profits after the large gains clocked up this year but the second trader reckoned that some investors may now be returning to the market particularly those that still have funds in cash to invest before the end of the year the economy ministry said friday tax revenue in october was 3.72 billion 12.5 percent higher than the same month a year earlier and 12.9 percent up on september in the money markets call money rates fell to 6.85 percent from 6.95 percent -- axel bugge buenos aires newsroom 541 3180668

following are views on the direction of philippine stocks on tuesday and main factors likely to affect trading investors are expected to remain defensive ahead of the federal reserve interest rate policy meeting traders said `` foreign investors are going back to blue chip countries like the u.s. and they are still underweighting the region our mettle is still being tested '' ramon adviento analyst at sun hung kai securities phils inc shares may move in a narrow range after three days of losses said elline salvatierra analyst at dharmala securities

a offering of 1 billion in new corporate bonds by rite aid corp was the main focus of the u.s. corporate bond market on tuesday as secondary market trading continued to be light traders said frank bergonzi chief financial officer at rite aid said the offering was increased to 1 billion from the original amount of 600 million as a result of particulary strong demand from investors rite aid will use the bulk of proceeds from the offering to refinance approximately 890 million of debt it assumed in connection with its recent acquisition of thrifty payless any remaining proceeds will be used to extend the maturity of existing rite aid debt bergonzi added he said `` we are pleased with the demand and ultimately the rates of the deal it lets us funnel our efforts fully into the intergration of thrifty payless instead of having to worry about additional financing '' the final offering consisted of 350 million of 6.70 percent five-year debt 300 million of 7.125 percent 10-year bonds and 300 million in 7.70 percent 30-year bonds goldman sachs co acted as lead underwriter for the deal a trader at another frim said investor demand was so strong for the rite aid offering becuase few issuers from the retail/industrial sector have tapped the market in recent weeks `` as opposed to the hundreds of millions of dollars of bank and finance paper we 've seen recently investors were jumping at a chance to get this paper '' elsewhere citicorp issued 300 million in capital securities due 2027 at a spread of 120 basis points over the treasury curve via a merrill lynch co inc led syndicate spreads across the investment grade market closed unchanged to treasuries amid light trading traders said the closing price on the benchmark 30-year treasury dropped 15/32 to 97-28/32 to yield 6.66 percent prices of high-yield bonds which tend to lag treasuries were off by 1/8 of a point on average a trader said this caused spreads on junk debt to tighten around five to six basis points he noted junk investors focused on trading of new issues on tuesday as volume in the broader secondary market remained low heartland wireless communications inc 's 125 million 14 percent senior notes due 2004 were bid at 102 near mid-session the deal by the rural wireless cable company priced at par after the market closed on monday bt securities corp was the underwriter tv filme 's 140 million in 12 7/8 percent senior notes traded up by 1/2 a point on tuesday after they were priced at par via bear stearns co inc on monday evening tv filme is a brazilian wireless cable services provider -- douglas brown 212-859-1662

u.s. municipal bonds gained around one-eighth to one-quarter of a point aided by a report that showed inflation was surprisingly mild though concerns that dealers inventories were rising checked the gains the december municipal bond futures traded on the chicago board of trade outperformed the cash market rising 16 ticks to 114-20/32 they were slightly outpaced by u.s. treasury bond futures which climbed 20 ticks to 110-21/32 as a result the mob spread between the two futures continued to narrow slipping to 127 ticks scheduled competitive and negotiated municipal bond sales are expected to total 2.446 billion in 105 offerings for the week of oct 14 according to reuters municipal bond information group market players were stepping back from the market ahead of the release of the consumer price index on tuesday these data also are expected to show that inflation is not heating up as economists projected a 0.1 percent increase the possibility that the recent strength displayed by the stock market will continue to hold the attention of individual investors left municipal bond traders concerned that dealers were starting to accumulate too much inventory `` i think more bonds are in dealers hands than was once suspected '' a trader said he cited continued selling by institutional customers who are trying to improve the structure of their portfolios and the scarcity of cash held by municipal bond funds further the calender for new issues contains some sizable offerings in the next two weeks competitive sales total 1.097 billion in 63 offerings the largest issue is a 200 million massachusetts bay transportation authority obligation issue on oct 17 negotiated sales total 1.349 billion in 42 offerings the largest issue is a 375 million new york city municipal finance water authority bond offering through painewebber inc the new york city municipal water finance authority had been considering delaying the bond sale by one week but instead decided to go ahead with it on october 16 the negotiated calender also includes 175 million of ohio taxable revenue bonds among competitive offerings the market was looking ahead to two sales by bond sales by san francisco international airport the 165 million offering is subject to the alternative minimum tax and the 110 million sale is not actively quoted issues on friday included denver colorado city and county airport revenues of november 2025 which pay a 5-1/2 percent coupon they were offered at 5.75 percent net down six basis points from levels seen on thursday and north central texas health facilities development corp revenues of june 2021 which carry a 5-1/2 percent coupon were offered at 5.79 percent net down three basis points -- joan gralla 212-859-1654

sydney futures exchange sfe wheat continued to rise in near-term contracts on thursday on concerns about dry weather in southern districts of australia 's eastern states and in south australia may 1997 the nearest contract added a 1.50 to a 185.00 a tonne on eight lots traded it was the only contract to change hands settlement prices for may and july 1997 also both advanced by 50 cents to a 1.50 while more distant contracts generally fell by 50 cents to a 1.50 `` the market has been a bit short and there 's been a fair bit of buying '' one broker said the main concern continued to be dry weather in the south and this would dictate whether the market would continue to rise he said new crop wheat futures had not risen as well as the near-term contracts he noted `` if we get some rain i think it might ease back '' he said australia wheat futures on april 10 per tonne last net ch settle volume open interest may7 185.00 +1.50 185.00 8 107 july7 187.00 137 sep7 183.00 2 nov7 174.50 49 jan8 172.50 64 mar8 174.00 4 may8 175.00 jul8 175.00 sep8 185.00 awb cash bid quotes for april 10 a per tonne new crop sorghum newcastle may a 161.00 june a 163.00 wheat 1996/97 crop asw/apw a 170.00 newcastle a 170.00 port kembla a 175.00 newcastle direct sale ah a 179.00 newcastle and port kembla aph price on application soft price on application multi-grade wheat asw base 1997/98 crop indicator price a 154.00 port kembla a 153.50 newcastle -- michael byrnes sydney newsroom 61-2 9373-1800

south african shares got a late boost from u.s. data that appeared to ease inflation fears across the atlantic but stocks still ended down as diamond giant de beers took a hammering on reaction to its half-year results local shares had traded under a cloud throughout the day as the market nervously eyed wall street to see if the current downwards trend in new york was set to continue but lower-than-expected growth in july retail sales and the seventh straight month of lower producer prices saw a u.s. stocks rally that carried into other financial markets south african shares usually trade on their own merits but have followed new york closely all week in the absence of any significant local factors despite the publication of favourable producer price inflation figures on tuesday but dealers said though the data boosted hopes for an interest rate cut the move was already well-factored into the market and was providing support rather than any spur for major gains instead local sentiment took a knock from a hammering in bellwether share de beers as traders bailed out of the diamond giant in the wake of disappointing half year results the share ended down 850 cents to 154.50 rand in trade worth 122 million rand and the fall-out knocked 350 cents off sister firm anglo american which ended at 264.50 rand in business worth 28 million rand overall dealers said the day was modestly busy as a hectic afternoon session followed on the back of a tepid morning 's trade the total value of shares traded hit 805 million rands and the day saw 163 counters rise as 210 fell the all-share index drops 41.9 points to 7,538.0 as the industrials shed 24.6 points to 9,243.1 in the gold sector shares rallied but ended off their highs as the bullion prices zig-zagged on international markets between 326 and 328 dollars an ounce the golds index added 9.1 points to 1,026.1

the board of sweden 's central bank the riksbank ended a meeting on tuesday with no changes announced to interest rates the riksbank last lowered its key interest rate the repo rate on december 17 it currently stands at 4.10 percent and was left unchanged at the bank 's weekly operation at 0730 gmt on tuesday its other key rates the deposit and lending rates are currently 3.75 percent and 5.25 percent respectively the bank 's board will next meet on april 10 -- belinda goldsmith stockholm newsroom +46-8-700 1017

latest gains in london metal exchange lme non-ferrous metals prices boosted by investment fund interest have led some analysts to suggest that they may signal another bull run in the sector on thursday zinc climbed to its best for nearly two years aluminium hit an eight-month peak tin and nickel rose to their best for four months and lead touched two-month highs and 1997 has also seen major investment houses issuing metal basket warrants and notes not seen since the last bull market `` it could be the return of 1993/94 when they were last issued '' said william adams of lme trader rudolf wolff and co earlier this week goldman sachs international issued warrants on a basket of metals as well as call warrants on copper zinc aluminium and its commodity index on thursday union bank of switzerland ubs launched a 100 million issue linked to the value of aluminium copper platinum and crude oil traders said these instruments which have a bias towards calls and could well be followed by others in coming weeks were positive for the metals market `` i do seem to remember that there were a whole host of them a couple of years ago they seemed to snowball as well '' one trader said `` we get bullish when we see this as the metal is going into strong hands '' another added he said that the institutions involved in that niche of the market would typically have buyers lined up for the issues and would already have their hedge cover in place this influx of investment fund money has implications for longer-term metal price movements as well analysts said `` consumers have not forgotten how they got caught in 1994 '' said nick moore of the flemings global mining group `` if 1997 is to be a re-run of 1994 then they would be unwise to twiddle their thumbs waiting for lower prices the time for bottom fishing has passed '' he added wolff 's adams noted that in the previous bull-run the investment-fund rally lifted prices at a time when metal inventories were rising and were at much higher levels `` there is much more potential now as stock levels are lower if they funds come in '' he said prices for lme metals this year in /tonne with end-1996 levels were as follows 1997 high dec 31 1996 copper 2,292 2,127 aluminium 1,625 1,546 nickel 7,490 6,465 zinc 1,133 1,060 lead 730 700 tin 6,130 5,840 -- london newsroom +44 171 542 8080

israeli shares closed sharply lower on thursday in thin trading amid sales by mutual funds traders said `` activity is low and the mood in the market is negative in the near future the market will continue to decline because investors are moving to more attractive investments '' a trader said `` everything depends now on progress made in the middle east peace process if there 's no breakthrough in the talks the market has no future '' he said israeli-palestinian talks were renewed this week following recent clashes that killed 74 people the benchmark mishtanim index of the top 100 shares fell 2.03 percent or 3.76 points to 181.68 on low turnover of 54 million shekels against 40 million on wednesday the maof 25 blue chip index lost 2.12 percent to 191.05 `` activity rose slightly today but the fact that the market is falling on higher volume is a bad sign the main sellers were the big mutual funds and this had a very negative impact on trading '' said ari eidelhet at central securities corp `` with such a low turnover every big seller affects the market immediately '' eidelhet said blue square chain closed unchanged at 2,411 ubs rated the company a `` buy '' noting they are trading at a large discount to its parent traded on the new york stock exchange the most active shares were teva pharmaceutical industries which fell 1.75 percent to 138,868 on volume of 4.7 million shekels koor industries which lost 2.0 percent to 27,008 on volume of 3.5 million shekels and bank hapoalim which fell 1.0 percent to 434 on turnover of 2.8 million shekels dan gerstenfeld tel aviv newsroom 972-3-537-2211

italian stocks closed generally higher helped up by lira and bond market strength on thursday with trade thin ahead of a three-day weekend beginning friday the blue-chip mib30 index closed 0.37 percent up at 14452 while the all-share mibtel stood 0.4 percent higher at 9626 total volume reached 460 billion lire of which some 120 billion lire was entirely down to trading on shares in state-controlled energy group eni mobile phone group tim climbed 3.19 percent to 3135 lire per ordinary share buyers were encouraged by results for the first nine months of this year tim 's digital gsm service had an operating result of just over 100 billion lire tim also decided to buy from its parent state telecoms holding stet a 49 percent stake in stet mobile holding giving it a potential foothold in the french mobile phone market stet itself was buffeted by various developments and eventually ended down 0.81 percent at 5259 lire managing director ernesto pascale was placed under investigation in a corruption probe in the north west italian town of aosta in the saga of stalled draft legislation to create a watchdog for italy 's telecoms and broadcasting sectors the far-right national alliance party said it was withdrawing obstructionist amendments to the bill meanwhile a far-left communist refoundation economic spokesman said an agreement between the government and the hard left could be found on creating a telecom authority the spokeman said the two camps positions were not irreconcilable and latest treasury suggestions were alright creation of a watchdog is essential to the privatisation of stet which the government wants to carry out before march 31 next year state energy company eni continues to attract high turnover although it ended at odds with the overall market down 0.07 percent at 7256 lire traders said the milan stock market is closed on friday and trading resumes on monday

cbot wheat futures closed mixed with nearby december dropping late on commercial selling with talk turkey may turn back shipments of u.s. wheat also mentioned traders said traders said cargill inc and merrill lynch futures each sold nearly two million bushels of december near the close wheat held firm much of the session on an impressive recovery in soybeans and on a short-term technical bounce `` it was a little technical correction early gains a little demand surfaced as u.s. soft red winter became mildly competitive '' said skip searcy of fimat futures but `` long term wheat trends remain bearish '' he said concerns about the fate of u.s. wheat exports to turkey apparently stemmed from rumors turkey may be clamping down on inspections of u.s. wheat cargoes `` it sounds as if the government is starting some kind of zero-tolerance program '' an mge trader said adding that the concerns included vomitoxin and tck smut wheat closed one cent pwer bushel lower to two cents higher with december down one at 3.98-1/2 and march down 1/2 at 3.91 technical indicators in wheat remain bearish traders said the key moving averages ma show the market remains poised for further declines with the four-day ma for december closing at 4.01 18-day at 4.19 and 40-day at 4.28-3/8 but the short term nine day relative strength index rsi for december ended at 21.995 points the market generally views an rsi of 30 or less as oversold and 20 or less as very oversold during wednesday 's session first resistance in december was at 4.03-1/4 a bushel and second resistance at 4.12-3/4 first support was at 3.93-3/4 and second support was at 3.84-1/4 wheat futures volume was estimated at 16,000 down from 22,304 tuesday according to the cbot in wheat options smith barney sold 300 december 3.80 puts at 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 cents refco inc sold 375 december 4.80 puts at 76-1/2 to 77 cents and paine webber bought 200 december 4.40 calls at 7/8 cent traders said wheat options volume was estimated at 7,000 down from 9,037 tuesday sam nelson 312-408-8721

enough supplies of imported gold in india and poor demand in pakistan may keep prices down in the sub-continent during the next few days dealers said on monday they said indian demand coming mainly from wedding season buying could match increased arrivals of imported metal may cushion the downward pressures `` a weak global trend and relatively firm local prices have triggered higher imports of gold by indian expatriates said bhayabhai sanghvi a leading dealer in the week to monday standard gold fell 30 rupees per 10 grammes to 4,750 rupees on the bombay bullion market as supplies of imported gold outmatched demand dealers estimate the cost of imported gold at around 4,720 rupees per 10 grammes which left a margin of 30 rupees on 10 kgs of gold that indian expatriates are allowed to bring in once every six months the margin works out to 30,000 rupees `` profit margins are attractive enough to import gold at present '' sanghavi said `` going by the weak world trend any price rise in the local market will be short-lived '' sanghavi said `` the market is more or less likely to remain subdued to steady in the coming days '' dealers in pakistan 's commercial city of karachi said gold prices are likely to remain mixed in the current week because of subdued demand inflation had curtailed savings and eroded the people 's purchasing power said dealer farooq qureshi at the karachi saraffa bullion market in dubai traders and wholesalers on sunday reported strong demand for the metal from india which helped compensate for a downturn in the gulf arab emirate 's own retail market dubai is a key distribution hub for india a leading gold consuming nation `` indian demand is very strong it is wedding season now and prices are low ... it will probably stay like this until the beginning of the monsoon in june '' said a dubai trader alhough indian sub-continent bullion demand traditionally tails off during monsoons from june to september traders said prices at current levels continued to fan demand there buoyant indian demand is expected to push dubai 's bullion imports to over 400 tonnes this year from 350 tonnes in 1996 according to analysts gold prices 24 carats u.s. debt futures finished mostly lower erasing the day 's gains in light volume following the treasury 's five-year note auction traders said `` despite the price action we 've pretty much held in here '' one floor source said september t-bonds fell to 108-20/32 in reaction to the auction which produced an average yield of 6.568 percent versus estimates of 6.55 percent the bid-to-cover ratio was 2.13 and noncompetitive bids were at 534 million the 108-20/32 level was monday 's low and also represents the 3-1/2-week settlement low however september t-bonds did not linger at the day 's lows and settled above the 100-day moving average at 108-23/32 while eurodollars also ended above their day 's lows most eurodollars settled unchanged even though selling was more aggressive in the eurodollar pit and the calender spreads widened out for instance the september to september 1997 spread widened more than 0.80 from about 0.40 one trader said `` but again we are not seeing a lot of volume '' he said adding that total estimated volume was 250,000 likewise estimated bond futures volume was around 280,000 with most of the volume attributed to traders rolling positions in september into december while the september contract does not expire until september 19 december becomes the lead contract month at the start of friday 's pit session one large u.s. firm sold 3,000 september bonds at the opening and then bought 2,000 september later in the day traders were mixed on whether or not buying would once again in the tokyo and london markets some attributed the strong foreign bid merely to the dollar/yen rally while others said foreign central bank buying would continue some traders said nervousness ahead of thursday 's weekly u.s. jobless claims report and the revised second-quarter real gross domestic product report could contain overnight losses claims are expected to rise to 330,000 versus 327,000 in the previous week while real gdp is seen up 4.2 percent at the end of pit trade september bonds were off 05/32 at 108-25/32 10-year notes were off 02/32 at 107-07/32 munibonds were up 10/32 114-27/32 december eurodollars were unchanged at 94.08 march eurodollars were also steady at 93.91 and march t-bills were also flat at 94.50 derivatives desk 312-408-8750 e-mail derivatives reuter.com

croatian stocks ended the year firmer in unexpectedly brisk trade on tuesday but analysts said an extended festive mood would slow market activity until late january `` trading on smaller volumes is commonplace at the end of the year so today was an exceptional day '' said josko milisa of the i.f.c brokerage he said no big developments would shake the market before the second half of january `` but i expect the zagreb bourse will be more energetic next year in line with croatia 's economic development '' he said five of eight issues that traded on tuesday rose two fell and one was flat volume doubled to 5,142 shares turnover also up at 7.6 million kuna fully-listed zagrebacka banka lost 20 kuna to close at 1,060 it was the most active issue selling 3,676 shares in a single transaction its gdrs trading on seaq international in london edged down to 20.375 after hitting 20.75 earlier this week the bank 's e-series rose 20 kuna to 450 trading 31 units another fully-listed stock drugs firm pliva traded flat at 14,000 kuna with 241 shares changing hands traders said both were poised for further growth in the new year top gainer cable maker elka jumped 55 kuna to close at 195 selling 18 shares in a first deal in two weeks milisa said the gain followed the company 's announcement of good profit in 1996 and favourable forecast for the year ahead traders said demand for both chocolate maker kras and food processor podravka was on the rise kras rose 30 kuna to 450 selling 114 shares food processor podravka was up 18 kuna to 231 after peaking at 235 kuna it sold 919 units biggest decliner hotelier jadranturist lost 15 kuna to 220 with 124 shares sold milisa said the stock could become more active in 1997

nyce cotton closed slightly down in rangebound and featureless activity market sources said prices should move higher as speculators believed to be holding heavy net short positions basis the july will have to buy in order to offset those positions prior to the contract 's expiry on june 24 trade selling should blunt gains however forcing the market to trade in a mostly sideways pattern before the u.s. department of agriculture releases its revised estimate of planted cotton area the march estimate put area at 14.48 million acres but industry sources believe that number has declined tuesday private analyst sparks cos pegged planted area at 13.89 million acres traders also await thursday 's weekly export and sales report the new-crop december contract settled at 75.40 cents a lb down 0.14 cent spot july ended 0.13 lower at 72.53 cents while the rest of the board finished 0.07 higher to 0.15 lower as of early tuesday open interest in july stood at 17,793 lots down 1,378 lots from the previous session trade scale-up selling could cap gains around 76.00 cents in the december contract but floods and rain in the delta could provide some support for new-crop futures analysts said volume was estimated at 11,500 lots compared with tuesday 's official 11,618 lots suzanne rostler new york commodity desk 212-859-1646

canadian bonds opened weaker on wednesday with a softer canadian dollar and weakness in u.s. treasuries weighing on prices analysts said `` it 's mainly concern about the currency this morning i do n't think the numbers necessarily had so much to do with it although they were pretty strong numbers '' said arve bendiksrud a fixed-income analyst with td securities inc. `` the fact that the u.s. market is a little bit weaker gives the canadian market a bounce weaker as well '' canada 's 30-year benchmark bond fell c 0.21 to c 116.46 to yield 6.716 percent the u.s. 30-year bond fell 8/32 to yield 6.71 percent the spread between the bonds narrowed to one basis point from two basis points at tuesday 's close the canadian dollar opened weaker at c 1.3928 us 0.7179 in after the unit traded in a narrow and weak range last night in overseas markets trader said the currency weakened further this morning to break past the key c 1.3950 level the currency trended weaker despite relatively positive economic data out this morning statistics canada reported that average industrial weekly earnings rose a higher-than-expected 4.0 percent in april from a year earlier the government agency also reported that the country 's leading indicator rose 0.7 percent in may from april economists had forecast the indicator would rise by 0.8 percent in other prices canada 's 10-year benchmark bond fell c 0.27 to c 108.09 to yield 6.147 percent compared to its u.s. equivalent which fell 8/32 to yield 6.44 percent the negative spread between the bonds was 29 basis points unchanged from the close of trading on tuesday the three-month cash t-bill yielded 2.83 percent against its u.s. equivalent which yielded 5.15 percent jeffrey hodgson 416 941-8105 e-mail jeffrey.hodgson reuters.com

emerging market debts moved lower in sympathy with u.s. treasuries and equities traders said `` people look at u.s. assets and wonder if the january rally is over '' said a trader with a major u.s. bank spreads have widened but many market watchers remained upbeat about the market 's longer term performance it was generally agreed that the emerging market debts going forward could not keep up with its neck-breaking pace of gains since beginning of the year but a sudden shift downward appeared unlikely `` nothing fundamental has changed '' said james barrineau emerging market fixed income specialist at smith barney `` the economic outlook remains favorable '' in a volatile market environment traders tended to become more sensitive to signs of social unrest which would have been downplayed in a rising market he said the case in point is the labor protests in venezuela and gathering discontent in ecuador barrineau said venezuela pars fell 1-1/8 to 67-1/8 bid and venesuela dcbs lost 5/8 to 90-3/8 bid ecuador pdi was off 5/8 at 65-1/8 bid traders noted that sentiment on mexico had turned mildly bearish since the release of the inflation data late thursday mexican consumer prices rose 1.60 percent for janaury 1-15 at the high end of the estimates both mexican equities and money market instruments reacted negatively to the data they said steadily declining trader surplus was also worrying they added the government reported the surplus in december was 220 million down from 254 million in novemer and october in september the surplus stood as high as 684 million mexico pars fell 3/4 to 90-1/4 bid and ums-26 lost 7/8 to 108-1/4 russia should have received a boost from the passage of its budget in the duma but prices were weighed down by the falling prices of other emerging debts traders said russia dollar vnesh dropped 1 point to 79-1/4 but minfins held much better with min fin 5 eased merely 1/8 to bid 41-3/4 the deadlock between bulgaria 's ruling socialists and the opposition over the formation of a new government put pressure on the already fragile bulgaria bradies and the prices slid further in choppy u.s. trading traders said bulgaria flrb tumbled 1-3/4 to 37-5/8 -- nailene chou wiest 212-859-1674

the dollar ended sharply higher against the swiss franc and rose to its highest level in 31 months against the mark on monday after the swiss finance minister said he was relieved with recent weakness in his country 's currency the dollar 's impressive performance against european currencies helped it regain its footing against the yen after retreating from a near four year high versus the japanese currency on friday the dollar resumed its climb on monday once again nearing the key 120 level `` the dollar has come back very well '' said russell lascala head of the spot trading desk at citibank `` people sold the swiss franc on the comments out of switzerland and the dollar was dragged higher against the mark as well '' after reaching a peak of 1.6493 marks its highest level since june of 1994 the dollar ended the day at 1.6470/75 marks up from 1.6365/75 at the open the dollar surged to a close of 1.4300/05 swiss francs against 1.4140/50 at the open swiss finance minister kaspar villiger told a wire service on monday that he was `` relieved '' by the weak swiss franc prompting a flood of franc sales which boosted the dollar against a host of european currencies dealers said the remarks were consistent with recent efforts on the part of the swiss central bank to push the franc lower as a means of jump-starting the sluggish swiss economy the dollar 's good tone against europe and in particular against the mark was also helped by renewed fears about the health of russian president boris yeltsin on monday a kremlin spokesman said doctors had advised the 65-year old leader who is recovering from pneumonia and has not been seen in public for three weeks not to leave moscow a scheduled trip to the netherlands where yeltsin was to have met dutch prime minister wim kok on february 4 was cancelled against the yen the dollar also performed well but dealers were hesitant to push it too high after talk last week that the japanese central bank had been defending the yen near the 120 level on friday the dollar reached 120.15 yen its highest level in 47 months before retreating on the rumors the dollar ended trading on monday at 119.55/60 yen up from 119.24/29 at the open `` although everyone is bullish on the dollar i think it 's harder to be as bullish on the dollar against the yen because of the psychological 120 level '' said lizbeth goldberg assistant vice president on the foreign exchange desk at bayerische hypotheken und wechselbank in new york `` as soon as we got to 120 last week there were all sorts of rumors about the bank of japan '' she added elsewhere sterling ended unchanged against the dollar at 1.6215/25 the greenback retreated modestly to close at canadian 1.3437/42 against 1.3462/67 at the open the australian dollar ended at 0.7721/26 up modestly from 0.7710/15 in early dealings -- noah barkin 212 859 1673

u.s. shares struggled for a clear direction on thursday as investors continued to keep a close watch on bond yields and u.s. treasuries with the yield on the benchmark 30-year long bond stubbornly standing above the seven percent level many european investors were reluctant to take new positions ahead of wall street 's opening dealers said `` the market is basically directionless today there is little business about '' one market maker said `` the long bond is holding pretty steady but people are still afraid that the yield will creep higher '' u.s. treasuries were slightly firmer with the june t-bond up 5/32 to 108-28/32 while the yield on the long bond stood at 7.03 percent by 1010 gmt only a handful of shares had traded my late morning dealers said philip morris cos inc eased 1/2 to 43-1/2 after a report in the wall street journal said opposition was building among some state attorneys general against a settlement plan with the tobacco industry that would limit future liability rjr nabisco holdings was down 1/4 to 32-1/4 the june s p 500 futures contract was down 0.65 to 849.90 -- dale faulken london newsroom +44 171 542 7717

low heating oil and diesel stocks in the united states and europe kept the heat under world oil prices on thursday with western consumers having barely dusted down their winter wardrobes heating oil futures at 231 a tonne in london and 72 cents a gallon in new york on wednesday are already running well above last winter 's highs set during one of the longest cold spells on record benchmark brent crude on wednesday traded 13 cents higher at 23.33 a barrel worried refinery buyers concerned that an early winter winter could eat into already depleted heating oil stocks have scrambled for supplies this week markets for heating oil in rotterdam and new york harbor both have seen premiums for prompt delivery rise quickly over the past couple of days refiners and traders have bought heavily on futures markets to protect themselves against higher prices this winter speculators have bet on further price gains `` it would be foolish to bet against this market going higher '' said a dealer in london `` it would be like standing in front of a freight train '' u.s. industry and government data this week showed heating and diesel stocks running some 30 percent below 1995 levels in the key u.s. northeast region the recent sale of a number of cargoes from the u.s. to europe has served as a significant brake on the replenishment of u.s. stocks which are still 19 million barrels below year-ago levels for the country as a whole but stocks in europe 's biggest market germany also are running well below normal oil analysts said an oil company drive over the last two years to cut costs by operating `` just-in-time '' inventory practices would make markets vulnerable to further price spikes during periods of tight supply markets are having to cope without several hundred thousand barrels a day of iraqi crude supplies after a u.n. oil-for-food deal was put on hold indefinitely after baghdad 's military incursion into kurdish safe havens earlier this month crude oil prices in dollars per barrel sept 26 sept 25 1545 gmt close dated brent 23.43 23.25 ipe london brent futures nov 23.36 23.20 nymex light crude futures nov 24.58 24.46

nebraska feedlot cattle sold at 110.00 per cwt on a dressed basis in active trading market sources said the price was steady with light activity on tuesday and steady to down 1.00 from the bulk of last week 's sales market sources said there also were light trades at 111.00 for cattle that will likely grade `` very choice '' one source said about 30,000 head had sold as of midday wednesday with more expected sources said bids at 68.00 on a live basis were also reported but no sales had occured yet they said bob janis 312-983-7347

u.s. corporate bonds fell into the close on thursday but resisted deeper losses in u.s. treasuries as the market snoozed ahead of the labor day weekend dealers said junk issues transtexas gas and payless cashways were lifted separately after favorable news treasuries came under pressure after the commerce department said it revised its estimate of second quarter gross domestic product upward to a 4.8 percent annualized rate of growth analysts surveyed by reuters expected the estimate to remain unchanged at 4.2 percent a reported 7.9 percent jump in single-family home sales for july sparked further selling analysts said lending credence to a near-term fed tightening the benchmark 30-year treasury bond closed down 23/32 to 96-12/32 to yield 7.04 percent back in the corporate arena traders said quotes reflected a slight improvement in spread but activity was so thin that levels were difficult to guage `` you 'd be wasting your time to try and get anything done today '' one trader said `` desks are half-staffed and we 're just biding time until the weekend '' turning to high-yield trade debt issued by building materials retailer payless cashways traded up on news its same store sales in august rose 2.5 percent from the same period last year traders said the 9.125 percent senior subordinated notes due 2003 were up four points to 66-1/2 bid 66-7/8 offer near the close elsewhere distressed credit transtexas gas corp 's debt improved when the firm announced it plans to sell some of its assets in a bid to reduce debt the transtexas 10.50 percent senior secured notes due 2000 were quoted at 104 bid 105 offer near the close up about two points on the day the company said it hired firms jefferies co inc and first union corp to assist in the sale of its lobo trend natural gas producing properties in webb and zapata counties of south texas and associated undeveloped acreage collins aikman products 11-1/2 percent notes due 2006 fell more than one point to 102-1/2 following news on wednesday the firm bought foamex international 's jps automotive unit the high-grade and high-yield primary markets were stagnant with no deals priced on thursday or expected to price on friday in fact syndicate managers said few if any new issues would come to market before the u.s. employment report is released in september the public securities association has recommended a 1400 edt/ 1800 gmt early close for the u.s. fixed-income markets on friday in observance of the labor day holiday -- al yoon 212-859-1672

yemen 's central bank on tuesday said its latest issue of 91-day treasury bills yielded an average of 13.13 percent down from 13.35 percent at the july 8 auction of the 1.6 billion rials worth of treasury bills on offer the issue attracted bids worth 1.46 billion rials the average price was 9,683.02 rials and the lowest accepted price was 9,630 rials yields ranged from 11.13 percent to 15.41 percent the latest issue of 182-day treasury bills yielded an average of 12.93 percent of the 600 million rials worth of 182-day treasury bills on offer the issue attracted 322.6 million rials the average price was 9,394.16 rials and the lowest accepted price was 9,261 rials yields ranged from 12.25 percent and 16 percent the latest issue of 364-day treasury bills yielded an average of 13.71 percent of the 400 million rials worth of 364-day treasury bills on offer the issue attracted subscriptions worth 280 million rials the average price was 8,797.23 rials and the lowest accepted price 8,752 rials yields ranged from 12.49 percent and 13.30 percent

monthly price talks for syrian crude exports in january were deadlocked on monday despite a revised offer from state-owned sytrol term buyers said sytrol began talks last week offering its light crude at a premium of 13 cents a barrel to benchmark dated brent but late last week cut it to brent less 10 cents after a frosty response from its customers term buyers said the new offer was still far too high representing only a five-cent reduction on december levels when the price of its main competitor russian urals has fallen by about 50 cents in the same period `` it 's tough going this month '' said a customer in the mediterranean `` we 're getting close to the first loading window so they will have to settle things soon but we 're not willing to pay more than dated -50 cents '' he added others said they were also expecting to receive telexes from damascus later on monday the value of sour crude in the mediterranean slid last week as iraq began selling its first exports for more than six years under an u.n. oil-for-food deal european refiners have signed up for as much as two-thirds of the 500,000 bpd baghdad is allowed to sell to raise 2 billion every six months for humanitarian purposes -- mark thompson london newsroom +44 171 542 7930

u.s. plains feedlot cattle wednesday sold in brisk activity at 69.00 per cwt up 1.00 from tuesday and up 3.00 from last week cattle feeders said about 56,200 head sold in the texas panhandle and western oklahoma area which brought the week-to-date estimate to 106,000 usda said kansas sales were pegged at 20,900 which brought the week-to-date figure to 67,300 most of this week 's showlists were expected to be sold by the end of wednesday although there were reports of a few owners passing bids at 69.00 in hopes of getting 70.00 for their cattle sources said `` i sold out this morning but i honestly think this market will continue going up '' one kansas feedlot manager said gains were attributed to rising beef prices and tight supplies of finished cattle sources said several loads of cattle that sold tuesday in kansas reportedly were being picked up early wednesday suggesting packers there were short on inventory kansas sources said fed cattle next week were expected to trade at 70.00 amid ideas that showlists will be smaller than this week and contain a greater percentage of unfinished or `` green '' cattle several cattle feeders said bob janis 312-983-7347

white sugar futures mostly opted to stay within the day 's tight trading ranges as the nearby december/march spread continued as the centre of market attention traders said on wednesday ranges were no more than 1.90 on any position and business was routine with no dominant feature to the listless session `` there was a little bounce in the market but it 's backed down the volume 's awful '' said one trader some broker selling of the key march contract was reported possibly against the paris market along with commission house buying of the dec/march spread `` it 's generally been pretty quiet there 's been a bit of buying in the dec/march '' the trader said at 1650 gmt december was 40 cents lower at 313.80 and march 90 cents down at 309.50 volume reached a modest 1,672 lots technically december and march are still moving downwards within a channel dating from reaction lows on september 17 despite the recent slight firmness analysts pegged december 's support at 310 after the contract broke through the previous 315 support level earlier this week this would now provide strong resistance they said paris trading was confined to the two nearby positions in an overall volume of 1,349 lots december was 70 cents lower at 312.80 and march down 50 cents at 309.80 -- jeremy smith london newsroom +44 171 542 8064

argentine stocks closed a bullish 1996 with a mixed tally monday and were seen firm when trading resumes thursday dealers said `` it was a pretty flat day with prices caught in narrow bands as everyone expected '' said emilio alessandro at brokers alessandro `` however the bolsa 's slight negative bias was fading towards the end of the session and we might see stocks switch back into positive territory thursday '' the bolsa 's blue-chip merval index shed 0.1 percent to 649.37 showing a 25 percent gain for 1996 last friday it closed at 650.23 the year 's record high `` the market was in a festive mood today -- everyone celebrated the end of a successful year and welcomed 1997 '' said alessandro describing the cheerful environment on the trading floor traders noted the slack pace of trading mirrored little action in the foreign markets `` dealing everywhere is grinding to a halt ahead of the new year '' said another trader `` here many players took the day off and for those who stayed in town it was a good time to take some profits '' floor volume shrank by slightly more than half since friday to 12 million pesos while over-the-counter volume dwindled to 25.4 million pesos from 72.6 million on friday the broad market index closed up 0.1 percent with winners edging out losers 24 to 19 and 23 issues closing flat the day 's top main-tier performers were construction stock polledo steelmaker siderca and carmaker ciadea which tacked on 2.0 percent 1.7 percent and 1.3 percent respectively merval losses were led by petrochemical concerns ipako and indupa which slid 2.5 percent and 1.7 percent each -- carmen pignotti buenos aires newsroom 541 318-0657

the won closed lower against the dollar on tuesday as demand for the u.s. unit continued to strengthen dealers said but the bank of korea 's supply of 1 billion on monday to local banks limited the dollar 's steep rise the won closed at 888.70 after opening at an intraday high of 888.20 it touched 888.90 the lowest level since the nation launched the market average system in march 1990 `` the central bank 's dollar supply helped support the won but the basic sentiment for the dollar has not changed '' said a foreign bank dealer the market was forecast to test the 890 level on wednesday the won 's mid-rate was expected to be pegged at 888.70 on wednesday compared with 887.30 today dealers said the won 's weakness stemmed from the nation 's widening trade deficit the reopening of a prosecution probe into a loan scandal involving hanbo steel co also dampened sentiment for the won by adding to the nation 's economic woes a domestic bank dealer forecast trading would range from 888.00 to 889.50 on wednesday while a foreign bank dealer put it between 888.50 and 889.30
the european union on thursday sold no intervention grain at this week 's export tender as exporters failed to submit any bids eu member country officials said -- paris newsroom +331 4221 5432

singapore shares closed lower on tuesday reflecting some uncertainty over the state of the local economy dealers said `` although the government is optimistic about our economy the man in the street and in business is more cautious and this is beginning to filter through into the markets '' said one dealer at a local broking house the key straits times industrials sti index ended off 7.85 points at 2,170.18 after a quiet day 's trading total volume was only 111.93 million shares with 136 gainers and 172 losers `` it is very quiet even for singapore '' one dealer said an off-market sale of 13.3 million keppel engineering shares to its sister company far east levingston shipbuilding was the day 's dominant trade in volume terms keppel engineering ended up 10 cents at singapore 1.54 snack food firm want want holdings also saw 6.15 million shares crossed off-market helping the shares rise three cents to a day high of us 2.50 dealers said institutions were sidelined after buying in the wake of interim results which pushed prices up in recent weeks few saw any immediate upturn in the sti index

the bulgarian lev closed at 221-223 per dollar softer than 219-221 in morning interbank trade because foreign currency demand outweighed supply following a interest rate cut dealers said `` banks and clients sought relatively large dollar volumes for pending payments and short-covering but supply was insufficient to meet demand '' a dealer said traders said the main reason for the rise in dollar demand was the cut of the main interest rate the central bank decided on thursday to cut its main interest rate to 20 percent monthly from 25 percent or 240 percent annually from all-time high 300 percent the new rate came into effect today `` dollar supply fell as banks and clients which pared forex positions under the prevoius rate and invested in high yield treasury paper now tried to avoid losses from a possible dollar rise '' another dealer said the central bank supported the lev by dollar sales at 219.50-220 levs in the morning but when it withdrew from the market in the afternoon the lev was pressured towards 221-223 per dollar traders said central bank officials declined comment the lev traded at 236-237 per dollar on september 23 when the central bank sharply hiked the main rate to 300 percent annually from 108 percent in a bid to restore confidence in the declining national currency -- anastas petrov sofia newsroom 359-2-84561

the mauritian rupee strengthened slightly against the dollar but weakened against the pound on wednesday in line with international trends foreign exchange dealers said the rupee was fixed at a mean commercial rate of 20.0035 against the dollar from 20.0230 on tuesday the rupee traded at a mean of 32.7075 against the pound from 32.6975 on tuesday dealers said the rupee 's fixing on wednesday reflected a weaker dollar in overnight international markets

sri lanka stocks continued to perform well in the second quarter to june on the back of improved interim profits posted by most local companies the colombo stock exchange said in its quarterly report on tuesday `` the all share index crossed the 800 point mark for the first time since april 1995 during the quarter '' the report said the index which gained 154.4 points in the quarter to june closed 10.1 points lower at 855.7 on monday turnover in the second quarter rose sharply to 6.4 billion rupees up from 2.2 billion in the pevious quarter the exchange said it said foreign participation in the market rose slightly to 40 percent during the quarter to june from 38 percent in the previous three months foreign net inflow in the market was 1.5 billion rupees sectoral performance was in line with rising indices with only two sectoral stocks recording declines `` land and property sector companies did not do well in the first half of 1997 '' the report said there was only one intial public offering by lighthouse hotel ltd that opened on the market in the second quarter the stock exchange said it introduced its on-screen trading system in early june which was expected to improve market liquidity the new system is scheduled to be officially launched on august 11

european union intervention grain stocks stood at 1.18 million tonnes on april 6 compared with 2.60 million tonnes at the start of 1996/97 july/june according to european commission figures released on wednesday the total included 314,263 tonnes of intervention soft wheat compared with 458,970 tonnes at the start of the season intervention barley totalled 370,104 tonnes against 1.34 million tonnes on july 1 1996 a further 492,412 tonnes of rye was held in eu intervention stores against 793,261 tonnes last july intervention maize stocks stood at 1,701 tonnes compared with three tonnes the totals are net after deduction of domestic and export market sales commitments -brussels bureau +322 287 6830

cbot corn futures closed firm on concerns about some forecasts for frost early next week in the northern portion of the u.s. midwest traders said `` people did n't want to be short for the weekend and we 'll see what happens monday with the weather '' said ron kucha of o'connor and co several meteorologists early friday cited the potential for frosty temperatures in northern iowa northern illinois southern minnesota and southern wisconsin another more severe cold system was expected sep 29-30 joel burgio weather services corp meteorologist said these temperatures should produce scattered frosts in low-lying areas but clouds or wind could limit the scope of the frost fund demand was estimated at nearly 10.0 million bushels with r.j. o'brien purchasing four million december and o'connor and co bought 4.5 million december the traders said cargill inc bull spread nine million dec/mar and adm investor services spread five million march/december they said corn closed 3/4 to two cents per bushel higher with december up 3/4 at 3.14-1/4 corn futures volume was estimated at 40,000 down from 52,344 thursday according to the cbot in corn options smith barney bought 1,200 may 3.60 calls at 9-1/4 sold 1,600 december 3.00 calls at 18-1/2 to 19 and bought 1,000 march 3.20 puts and sold 1,000 july 3.20 puts at 1-1/2 cents the traders said options volume was estimated at 18,000 down from 20,234 thursday sam nelson 312-408-8721

banco de mexico sought to drain 4.994 billion pesos from the secondary market on tuesday through a combination of three direct sales of paper and six repurchase agreements dealers said the cetes sales were offered or assigned as follows amount term 500 million 331 days 500 million 176 days 500 million 86 days the terms and maturities of the repurchase agreements were offered as follows 600 million 51 days 600 million 45 days 700 million 37 days 700 million 23 days 600 million 16 days 294 million 1 day *amounts in pesos -- mexico city newsroom +525 728-9559

lithuania 's listless and illiquid bourse remained locked in the summer doldrums with few gains seen on the horizon ahead of six-month results dealers said on thursday the official list which tracks the market 's five top shares fell 17.68 points to 884.41 points group a shares inched up 0.48 points to 1871.71 points while the central market turned over a sluggish 411,026 litas `` it 's quite silent '' said one broker `` we can feel that it 's summer '' brokers say that summer-inspired sluggishness and anxiety over approaching six-month results are punishing shares hermis bank which together with rival vilniaus bank inspired the bourse 's mild rally last week remained in steady but active trading at an unchanged 190 litas in trade of 120,650 litas on the central market hermis which has become one of the darlings of the otherwise sleepy stock exchange also saw 182,870 litas worth of block trades between 185 litas and 190 litas rival vilniaus bank dropped to 220.10 litas from 230 litas amid a tiny central market turnover of 2,201 litas rokishkis cheese another one of the market 's few star performers slipped to 40.50 litas from 42.00 litas amid central market turnover of 23,125 litas fridge maker snaige dropped to 12.30 litas from from 13.50 litas -- burton frierson vilnius newsroom +370 2 22 35 18

norwegian shares led by industrial giant norsk hydro soared to an all-time high on wednesday boosted by a strong dollar and a rally on overseas markets oslo 's total index ended 1.37 percent up at 1,264.58 points for a record close turnover was moderate at 792 million crowns a 0.25 percentage point rise in official interest rates by the norwegian central bank failed to dampen the market `` we thought the rate hike would act as a brake but we only thought so for half an hour '' one broker said `` the dollar is strong europe is up unless there is a correction abroad there will not be a correction here either '' hydro which will present first-half results on monday rose three percent to a record 414 crowns and was the most traded share at 136 million crowns `` there are many small buyers in hydro today and at the same time many large norwegian investors have already sold over the past few weeks so there 's generally a lack of sellers '' one broker said a reuter poll of nine analysts forecast first-half pre-tax profits of 6.09 billion crowns for hydro slightly down from 6.14 billion crowns a year ago

csce coffee futures tumbled for the second straight session thursday pressured by speculative and trade selling amid an easing of nearby supply concerns dealers said july arabicas slid 21.05 cents -- or more than eight percent -- on the day to 230.50 cents a lb after ranging between 252.00 and 228.00 cents second-month september shed 15.70 cents to 209.40 cents while the back months closed 6.25 to 9.90 lower the july/september spread continued to shrink from more than 40 cents seen last week closing at 21.10 cents today from 26.45 cents wednesday `` the near-term psychology has changed '' said smith barney analyst walt spilka `` the front month was at such a premium to the second month it was a signal to anyone who had coffee to sell as much as they could '' he added `` colombia is indicating to exporters go sell what you can and brazil exports are already way ahead of last year '' although little market-moving news emerged today traders news out of second-largest producer colombia since late last week continued to weigh on sentiment colombian exporters last week said they were having a hard time finding buyers for about 300,000 60-kg bags of green coffee for shipment in june because the beans had essentially been priced out of the market tuesday colombian finance minister jose antonio ocampo announced the country was opening `` unlimited '' coffee registrations for july-august a period in which he said the country was expected to export up to 2.5 million 60-kg bags of coffee `` the market is anticipating the opening of colombian registrations '' one trader said `` and we 're going into the low consumption period he said `` besides producers have shipped a lot of coffee and it 's just caught up '' international coffee organization ico data released thursday showed exporting members exports rose to 50.07 million 60-kg bags in the first seven months of the current 1996/97 coffee year to april from 43.49 million in the same 1996 period ico said brazil 's exports in april were up to 1.4 million bags from 732,000 bags in the same 1995/96 period while supply worries may be alleviated in the short-term some analysts said they may re-emerge later this summer ahead of many latin american countries fall harvest `` stocks will dwindle away and there may not be enough coffee in august and september to make it to the next crop '' said smith barney 's spilka `` there aught to be very little coffee for the september contract delivery '' volume reached an estimated 13,689 lots -- patricia avidan new york commodity desk 212 859 1640

mexican stocks pared earlier losses but closed down on monday after what traders said was a listless session in which share prices drifted in line with the dow jones `` we had a really slack day today one of the worst in a long time with scant turnover and not even much same-day buy-sell dealing '' a desk trader the leading ipc share index .mxx ended down 15.16 points or 0.40 percent at 3,760.55 trading volume .tv.mx was lackluster at 61.3 million shares traded of which cross trades accounted for almost one-half traders said dealing was in the doldrums due to the lack of foreign brokers in the market analysts and dealers said the ipc rebounded from a session low of 3,735.98 points on light last-minute bargain-hunting prompted by a recovery on wall street the dow jones ended up 0.29 percent at 6,955.48 points after being in negative turf for most of the day `` buyers stepped in close to 3,730 points because the bourse respected support there and confirmed resistance at 3,750 points '' said hector jimenez a technical analyst at the inverlat brokerage in mexico city `` what helped us was the upward adjustment in the dow jones and the price of u.s. long bonds '' jimenez added the u.s. 30-year treasury bond pared earlier falls and closed off 6/32 to yield 6.96 percent the broad market echoed the downward trend in blue chips out of a total of 95 stocks traded sliders outnumbered gainers by 49 to 25 telecomms firm telmex l shares off four centavos at 15.86 pesos weighed most heavily on the market followed by retail stock cifra c shares which fell 22 centavos to 10.84 pesos telmex l and cifra c shares together accounted for one-third of all shares traded traders said cifra c traded relatively heavily on a company buyback debt-ridden holding company sidek headed the prominent gainers .pg.mx up two centavos to 46 centavos on what dealers said was low-volume speculative buying traders said other leading gainers and decliners .pl.mx were shares whose prices had moved after thin-volume and unrepresentative deals dealers expected share prices on tuesday to respond to the outlook for the primary cetes auction to be held that evening and said they also awaited january industrial output figures `` i think some are waiting for prices to fall further before buying it seems that we have already gone on vacation '' one trader said referring to forthcoming pubic holidays -- karina balderas mexico city newsroom +525 728-9562

copper prices tumbled on thursday hurt by a report that more than half a million tons of the metal may be stashed in hidden stockpiles heating oil prices rallied as cold weather in the midwest and on the east coast kept stocks tight the knight ridder commodity research bureau index of 17 futures contracts rose 1.08 points to 243.41 the world bureau of metal statistics on wednesday estimated that nearly 600,000 metric tons of copper not previously reported may have built up in netherlands warehouses between 1991 and 1995 the report came as traders were already eyeing warily a drop of more than 60 percent in london metal exchange stocks since early september to a six-year low of 109,175 tons `` there is metal disappearing off the lme and it is clearly not going into consumption the market can not go from showing a small surplus to major deficit in a month something strange is happening to lme stocks '' said peter hollands of bloomsbury minerals economics many however were sceptical about the bureau report `` i have been to european smelters who hold say 20,000 tons of stock that takes up a tremendous amount of space so i can not imagine what 20 times that would take up '' one european industry source said switching metal between the highly visible lme warehouses and secretive off-market stores may have allowed sumitomo corp. 's former head trader yasuo hamanaka to operate without discovery for years in june sumitomo fired hamanaka after it alleged that he admitted running up losses now put at 2.6 billion in 10 years of unauthorised trading hamanaka has since been arrested and charged with fraud `` there was some hidden inventory associated with hamanaka and it probably was around 100,000 tons it has now disappeared '' said independent analyst simon hunt copper for december delivery fell 2.05 cents to 95.85 cents a pound at new york 's commodity exchange heating oil rallied for the second straight session in new york after inventory data failed to show a significant buildup in heating oil supplies amid unseasonably cold weather in many parts of the united states `` we are in a strong buying mode during a time of a heating oil supply problem when it is a lot colder in the midwest and east coast '' said james cordier a trader with allendale inc december heating oil jumped 2.20 cents to 73.40 cents a gallon at the new york mercantile exchange december crude oil rose 29 cents to 24.41 barrel and december gasoline added 0.58 cent to 68.92 cents a gallon on wednesday the american petroleum institute api said distillate stocks which includes heating oil and diesel fell 827,000 barrels for the week ended nov. 8 heating oil stocks grew a meagre 120,000 barrels with growth restrained by increased demand last week in preparation for this week 's cold spell in the northeast `` heating oil stocks is a little more than 14 million barrels below a year ago and that 's the key right there '' said bob yawger trader with e.d f. man international inc weather services corp. forecast temperatures will continue to be eight to 15 degrees below normal in the northeast and up to 12 degrees below normal in the midwest temperatures are expected to moderate to normal next week in both regions traders said the forecast for warmer temperatures could trigger profit-taking in the oil complex in the next two sessions

dhaka stocks closed marginally higher as both sellers and buyers were active on wednesday brokers said the dhaka stock exchange dse all-share price index closed 7.45 points or 0.61 percent up at 1,225.49 on a turnover of 57.6 million taka of 125 traded issues 50 gained 70 lost and five were unchanged national tubes gained 48 taka to 1,218 food scrips pran lost 11 to 705 and monno fabrics was up 1.36 to 151.43 dhaka newsroom +880-2-506363

nasdaq shares continued to rise for the fourth consecutive session as a broad rally in technology stocks extended to small capitalization stocks which have been overlooked in recent weeks traders said the nasdaq composite index gained 9.74 points or 0.77 percent to close unofficially at 1270.50 the rise offset a 33 point or 0.46 percent drop in the dow industrials which closed unofficially at 6976 advancing nasdaq issues beat declining issues 2356 to 1811 on total volume of 621 million shares nasdaq shares have risen in eight of the previous 10 sessions `` it 's a continuation of what we 've seen in the past few days some big name techs have been strong lately but the strength has spread through all the technology sectors '' one trader said networking stocks continued their recent ascent while technology heavyweights intel corp and dell computer corp also firmed this optimism helped boost smaller companies such as discreet logic and cylink corp traders said traders also pointed to vlsi technology inc which gained 2 to 21-7/8 after a bullish revenue forecast

the zimbabwe dollar closed on monday softer on the u.s. dollar and pound sterling but was quoted firmer against the mark and the rand after a fairly quiet interbank session dealers said `` nothing much really happened today the market was a bit short so everyone wanted to avoid buying unnecessarily by quoting high we were all just protecting our positions '' one dealer said `` there was no sign of the reserve bank today to bail out the zimbabwe dollar he added at monday 's close the zimbabwe dollar was trading at 11.0575/0675 against the u.s. dollar from late friday 's 11.0400/0500 while against sterling it slipped to 17.9200/9400 from 17.8890/9185 it however posted gains on the mark at 6.5300/5500 from 6.5495/5580 and was also a touch firmer against south africa 's rand at 2.5000/5200 compared to 2.5020/5060 -- stella mapenzauswa harare newsroom +263-4 72 52 28/9

tokyo stocks were buffeted in another volatile session on tuesday falling sharply before rebounding hong kong 's market however was subdued ahead of the release of key u.s. inflation data later in the day other asian markets were generally mixed seoul shares topped the list of winners with a gain of more than 4 percent tokyo traders said the japanese market 's rebound could mark the end of frenzied selling -- at least for now brokers said last-minute buying of blue chips rescued the nikkei average from its loss of over 500 points in early trading the benchmark average of 225 leading shares closed 25.66 points or 0.14 percent lower at 18,093.13 despite the rebound many brokers warned that perils of a resumed tumble remain `` what the government needs to do is to take swift action to realise structural reforms in the economy '' said masaru takagi chief economist at fuji research institute hong kong stocks closed slightly higher ahead of the u.s. inflation report the hang seng index scraped out a 4.66-point advance to close at 13,293.87 `` if this cpi consumer price index report turns out to be a non-event i think we will see both the u.s. and hong kong markets move up again '' said charles cheung executive director at j a securities south korean stocks closed sharply higher after a weak response to all-out strike calls and increasing fund inflows boosted sentiment brokers said blue-chip manufacturing stocks which stood to be major casualties from the strikes soared to close at daily limits the composite index climbed 4.1 percent or 27.05 points to a provisional close at 686.59 thai stocks finished 1.85 percent lower amid worries over whether banks would get involved in a government plan to help troubled property developers brokers said the set index fell 15.22 points to 807.67 the bombay 30-share index rallied for the sixth consecutive session to end 34.28 points or 0.99 percent higher at a provisional close of 3,487.44 in singapore the benchmark straits times industrials index ended at 2,215.52 down 16.88 points a fall in kuala lumpur stocks was sparked by a lack of foreign institutional buyers profit taking and concerns over the weak tokyo bourse traders said the composite index of 100 large-capitalised stocks fell 9.34 points to 1,211.04 `` we have been strong in the last two weeks i think today is profit taking and forced selling '' said one research chief taiwan shares saw their strong opening evaporate as a surge through six-year resistance at 7,200 sparked profit-taking from a recent five percent rally the index lost 51.71 points or 0.72 percent to end at 7,137.76 off a midsession high of 7,246.66 manila stocks paused for a respite closing slightly lower after a seven-day run as players sold blue-chip issues the main index ended down 8.59 points or 0.26 percent at 3,261.72 australian shares ended a listless session marginally lower as traders found little inspiration locally or elsewhere the all ordinaries index shed 2.9 points to 2,419.4 february brent was last traded at 23.40 per barrel down eight cents from london while march shed nine cents to 23.05 hong kong gold bullion ended at us 356.80/357.30 an ounce against new york 's us 358.30/70 close on monday the dollar was clawing ts way back up again against the yen in late tokyo after falling earlier on remarks by the toyota motor president that an appropriate dollar/yen level would be 100-110 yen at 1101 gmt the dollar traded at 116.43/48 yen and 1.5881/88 marks

the estonian stock market edged up on monday but in sluggish holiday trade with low investor activity and a turnover of just 15.3 million kroons dealers said prices saw slight changes as the index gained some 0.08 percent and rose to 160.78 market leader hansabank was the most traded share again on the main list with volumes of seven million kroons but closed lower at 161.45 kroons versus 162.25 forekspank turned over 3.5 million kroons and also closed slightly lower at 122.20 kroons against 122.25 the small evea bank which was introduced into the secondary list on monday turned over some 1.8 million kroons and closed at 25 kroons `` there is a myth that every new stock on the bourse faces an enormous increase this probably is the reason why evea was so active '' one dealer said evea bank has 371 million kroons of eleven months assets and pre-tax profit of 9.1 million the second biggest bank estonian savings bank was trade worth 1.7 million kroons and ended higher at 68.75 kroons against 67.50 the over-the-counter market was led by tallinna kaubamaja department store which turned over shares worth 2.3 million kroons and closed slightly higher at 76 kroons against 75.75 kroons the total volume of the free market was 4.8 million kroons the tallinn stock exchange is open on december 31 but closes an hour earlier than usual at 1100 gmt -- riga newsroom +371-721-5240
