japan 's industrial production for the july-september quarter is forecast to rise 1.5 percent from the previous quarter and to rise 3.7 percent from the same period a year earlier a ministry of international trade and industry miti official said on monday earlier the ministry said japan 's industrial production in august fell a preliminary 1.9 percent from the previous month on a seasonally adjusted basis

u.s. treasury secretary robert rubin urged japan friday to guard against a resurgence in its trade surplus but rejected suggestions that a stronger japanese currency was the best way to do that rubin told the american chamber of commerce here that japan needed to promote strong domestic demand for its products open its markets further to imports and deregulate its economy `` it is critical that japan 's current account surplus not rise again to a level that is detrimental to global growth that causes trade friction with japan 's trading partners and that could fuel protectionist sentiments '' he told the business leaders after meeting prime minister ryutaro hashimoto japan 's trade surplus rose in february for the first time in two years as the weak yen helped make the nation 's exports more competitive in world markets speaking to reporters on his way here rubin made clear that he did not see a stronger yen -- and by inference a weaker dollar -- as the best way to contain and cut japan 's surplus `` we do n't believe in anybody using their currency for trade policies -- us or anybody else '' he said u.s. business leaders however made clear to rubin that they were concerned about the weakness of the yen -- which has fallen about 50 percent against the dollar over the past two years boosting japanese competitiveness in the process `` at current exchange rates our profitability here is being killed '' robert orr director of government relations for nippon motorola ltd told rubin rubin has consistently maintained that a strong dollar is in america 's interests -- a stance he alluded to on friday -- because it keeps down u.s. inflation and interest rates but he has also recently taken to saying that the u.s. currency has been strong for some time in an apparent effort to signal that he is not eager to see a further dollar advance the dollar did rise on friday jumping more than one yen to 123.79 yen in late asian trade as the market took rubin 's remarks to mean he would not actively push for a stronger yen publicly rubin appeared willing to give japan the benefit of the doubt -- for now -- that its policy gamble of mixing fiscal tightening with promised deregulation could achieve growth without relying on an export drive some u.s. officials are worried that a rise in japan 's sales tax that took effect this week will sap demand at home and force japanese companies to seek bigger profits overseas `` i do n't think there is any question ... about his prime minister ryutaro hashimoto 's commitment to deregulation and economic growth in japan it strikes me as a very sound policy path to be on '' rubin told a news conference but rubin reserved judgment as to whether japan 's policy would succeed `` only time will tell '' he said the treasury chief warned that washington and other trade partners had `` enormous interest '' in how japan 's economy fared and whether tokyo would act if its policy gamble failed japanese officials said hashimoto agreed with rubin at their half-hour meeting that domestic demand-led growth was important for japan as it was for the united states hashimoto repeated japanese assurances that tokyo 's surplus was unlikely to grow drastically and that the economic impact from the consumption tax rise would be limited looking back over the past four years rubin said that both the united states and japan had worked hard to iron out trade friction and strengthen their economic relationship he noted that japan 's current account surplus -- the broadest measure of trade -- has fallen from the equivalent of 3.1 percent of gross domestic product in 1993 to 1.4 percent four years ago washington tried unsuccessfully to convince tokyo to adopt a surplus target of 1.5 to 2 percent of gross domestic product but rubin said friday that washington did not have a target for the surplus now his visit to japan follows a series of trips to tokyo by u.s. officials including vice president al gore and deputy treasury secretary lawrence summers but rubin denied there was a concerted u.s. strategy to turn up the heat on japan rubin was to leave tokyo later in the day for a meeting of asia-pacific finance ministers in the philippines

italy received encouraging words from one major economic body on tuesday in its battle to qualify for a single european currency but appeared to get a warning from another key organisation the organisation for economic cooperation and development oecd said heavily indebted italy was `` within reach '' of meeting key goals laid out in the maastricht treaty for founder members of european economic and monetary union emu a report by the paris-based group said prime minister romano prodi faced a daunting task as he tried to halve italy 's budget deficit this year to meet one of the key emu criteria but added `` such a reduction is not unprecedented among oecd economies '' prodi 's centre-left government has introduced a string of tough budget moves over the past 12 months in a bid to wrestle the deficit down to three percent of gross domestic product gdp from 6.7 percent in 1996 the oecd said many of the measures introduced so far had been tax hikes or financial operations and urged the government to embark on structural spending cuts to keep a lid on the deficit in coming years however the annual report of the european monetary institute emi lashed out at one-off measures to reduce deficit to gdp ratios saying they `` can not be regarded as contributing to sustainability '' the forerunner of a european central bank said heavy reliance on higher revenues rather than spending cuts to rein in deficits was `` a ground for concern '' while not mentioning any countries by name many analysts took the remarks to be aimed at italy among others only about one year remains before the european commission reaches a final decision based on 1997 data on which eu states would qualify for emu prodi said in an interview published on monday that he was confident italy would meet the strict maastricht parameters adding that italians knew that joining european monetary union was `` a battle that counts for centuries '' the prime minister told time magazine that if italy failed to join from the start `` i would feel compelled to resign '' aware of unease in the emi and germany over the methods being used to get italy to the starting line for a single currency prodi has pledged to introduce an overhaul of the politically sensitive welfare state before the end of the year while italy 's social spending is slightly less than the eu average analysts say the system is unbalanced with too much money being channelled into generous state pensions as the population ages this represents a budget time bomb `` the government is committed to start examining this over the coming weeks '' treasury minister carlo azeglio ciampi told reporters on tuesday but analysts said the main problem for italy remained the huge servicing costs on its debt mountain `` the crucial point is interest spending '' said andrea conti an analyst with deutsche bank in milan the more the markets believe that italy will lower its deficit the more interest rates will fall and the oecd said italy could expect significant interest savings this year as the country 's economic credibility improved it called on prodi and ciampi to stick to their guns `` the task faced by macroeconomic policies is unusually demanding and with the outcome remaining subject to considerable uncertainty success requires a sustained policy effort to which the government is committed '' the oecd added

municipal finance banker calvin grigsby head of grigsby associates has vowed to fight to maintain his alameda county calif. bond business according to a published report wednesday contra costa times newspaper reported that grigsby came to the county administrative offices on tuesday to make his case to the board of supervisors to remain lead underwriter for a 293 million bond sale the county supervisors delayed any decision for two weeks the newspaper reported `` i won the deal fair and square on a competitive-bid basis '' grigsby told the contra costa times grigsby acknowledged that his san francisco-based firm had undergone a massive shakeup but said grigsby associates was now recapitalized and was stable `` i think the firm is stabilized now '' grigsby said `` i 've been back to work for a month and a half and have talked to all the institutional buyers and we 're comfortable '' formerly known as grigsby brandford co grigsby 's firm has undergone a dramatic shake-up since september when grigsby the firm 's founder and long-time chairman abruptly announced his resignation after he left it was disclosed that authorities were investigating bond deals the firm handled in dade county fla. grigsby has not been charged with any wrongdoing in the probe several weeks after he left grigsby rejoined his firm renaming it grigsby associates the controversy surrounding grigsby has taken a toll on his bond business across the country and in alameda county in october grigsby was removed as a remarketing agent for commercial paper issued to renovate two alameda county sports facilities in alameda county on tuesday grigsby said that he felt confident his company was capable of overseeing the 293 million debt sale to finance the county 's employee pension fund the contra costa times reported but in a recent report to county supervisors the county 's administrator said that financial advisers believe the `` market 's perception of recent events involving grigsby brandford co could adversely impact the marketing of the county 's bonds '' county administrators are recommending that grigsby be bumped from the lead position and replaced by either of two co-senior underwriters -- adam entous 415-677-2511

seven eastern and central european launched a drive on tuesday to lure more singapore investors into their emerging markets the singapore trade development board tdb which promotes foreign investment in singapore and encourages firms to invest overseas said singaporeans had shown interest in manufacturing trading infrastructure and hospitality services the tdb will lead a trade mission of 15 to 20 singapore firms in may to poland slovenia hungary czech republic bulgaria croatia and latvia the countries involved in a conference staged to launch the investment drive `` we hope to highlight the business opportunities available and increase market transparency of the region '' barry desker tdb 's chief executive officer told the conference singapore 's bilateral trade with eastern and central europe has grown 200 percent since 1990 to singapore 3 billion us 2 billion in 1996 desker said singapore 's total investment commitment in the region has reached over s 500 million mainly in real estate manufacturing and warehousing he said bank austria 's franz horhager told the conference that potential investors should not venture into these markets alone `` you need to be guided into these markets once you 're guided you can circumvent easily the traps pitfalls problems with local currencies and government regulations '' said horhager the bank 's director of international commercial banking and global networking management horhager said he was optimistic about the investment advantages these former communist countries had over asia 's emerging economies like cambodia or burma given their abundantly cheap skilled labour force `` in eastern central europe people are skilled technicians engineers the percentage of academdic degree is extremely high that 's their main thrust hizbollah attacked the lebanese government 's budget policies on thursday accusing it of proposing unrealistic spending plans to parliament and then massively exceeding them ammar moussawi one of the pro-iranian group 's seven deputies told parliament the 1997 draft budget did not reflect government financial policy because most investment spending took place outside the budget and was financed by foreign debt speaking on the second day of the annual budget debate he called the government 's proposal fragile and said its spending and deficit ceilings did not inspire confidence `` last year 's experience was not encouraging since spending exceeded its ceiling by more than 700 billion lebanese pounds 450 million and the planned 35 percent deficit of revenue against expenditure jumped to 51 percent '' moussawi said the 1996 deficit target was in fact 37.6 percent but the actual deficit reached 51 percent due to damage caused by a heavy israeli attack on lebanon in april and a slowdown of economic growth during the year however the deficit also overran government targets in 1994 and 1995 of 43 per cent and 44 percent reaching 57 percent and 47 percent respectively and accusations have intensified that the government routinely presents unrealistic budgets pro-government deputies dominate the 128-member parliament and it is expected to approve the budget on saturday despite the tough criticisms during the first two days of the debate the draft proposes expenditures of 6,433 billion pounds and revenues of 4,100 billion pounds -- a deficit of about 36 percent proposed spending is slightly lower than 1996 projections and planned revenue is slightly higher moussawi warned the government against increasing taxes to reduce the deficit referring to media reports of possible increases of petrol and electricity prices he said `` we warn that this could lead to a wide popular explosion '' he proposed instead the introduction of progressive taxation to replace the current 10 percent flat rate for income and corporate tax in another attack on the government hassan alawiyyeh a shi'ite moslem deputy told parliament lebanon 's indebtedness was reaching a dangerous level `` this budget depends mainly on domestic and foreign debt and debt figures have touched the red line threatening negative implications for future generations '' alawiyyeh said foreign and domestic debt have risen sharply in the past four years because much of lebanon 's multi-billion-dollar reconstruction drive is being carried out through foreign borrowing while the budget deficit is financed by heavy domestic borrowing foreign and net domestic debt have each more than doubled since december 1994 foreign debt has risen to 1.769 billion from 772 million and net domestic debt to 13,315 billion lebanese pounds from 6,682 billion total debt reached 10.348 billion at end of december 1996 a figure which according to one parliamentary deputy approaches lebanon 's estimated annual gross domestic product 1 1,549.75 lebanese pounds

the indian finance ministry said on tuesday that the federal budgetary deficit between april and august totalled 109.17 billion rupees down from an average of 169.90 billion over the same five-month period in the last five fiscal years the ministry released a table of figures which were mentioned by finance minister p. chidambaram in remarks earlier on tuesday to the world economic forum the figures compared receipts expenditures and the revenue deficit for april-august as a percentage of the projected budget estimate of those categories for all of 1996/97 april-march with the average for the first five months of the last five fiscal years april-aug 1996 average last 5 yrs -tax revenues 31.2 pct 31.1 pct -capital receipts 31.7 pct 28.3 pct -total receipts 30.8 pct 29.8 pct -expenditure 31.5 pct 33.8 pct -revenue deficit 26.9 pct 44.3 pct -- new delhi newsroom +91-11 301 2024

the european union is 95 percent near to agreeing on a stability pact which will oblige members of monetary union to stick to fiscal discipline after a single currency is launched in 1999 a member of the eu 's powerful monetary committee said on monday yves mersch treasury director at the luxembourg finance ministry noted at a conference that eu finance ministers had agreed last weekend in dublin on the principle of a stability pact with sanctions for those running excessive budget deficits `` the sanctions will not be left to haggling we are trying to have a presumption that once a country has an excessive deficit it will be sanctioned unless it takes active steps '' to change the situation mersch said `` we are up to 95 percent close to agreement '' he said eu finance ministers have asked the monetary committee to come up with proposals on the details of how to run a stability pact ahead of hoped-for approval by eu heads of state at a summit in dublin in december

venezuelan foreign reserves figures will be released monday instead of the more usual friday the central bank said the bank said technical problems had prevented them from compiling the weekly bulletin of macroeconomic indicators the bulletin would be ready monday afternoon however the bank said -- caracas newsroom 582 505 2600

a widely watched index of manufacturing activity rose in december the nation 's purchasing managers said thursday sending a shiver through financial markets and driving stock and bond prices lower the national association of purchasing management said its index of maufacturing activity rose to 54.0 in december from 52.7 in november a reading above 50 points to growth in manufacturing while one below that level indicates contraction stock and bond prices fell after the report which apparently worried some investors that stronger economic growth might lead to a pickup in inflation and higher interest rates bonds which had risen earlier in the session reversed course after the report which in turn helped send the dow jones industrial average down about 93 points to 6,355 in early trading the stock market was especially nervous following tuesday 's 101-point slide traders in the inflation-sensitive bond market drove the 30-year treasury bond down 1-7/32 or 12.1875 on a 1,000 bond raising its yield to 6.74 percent from 6.64 percent on tuesday bond prices and yields move in the opposite direction inflation is a bond investor 's worst enemy because it erodes the returns on long-term investments the nation 's financial markets were closed on wednesday for new year 's day

chinese vice premier li lanqing said on wednesday the world trade organisation wto would be ineffective without china as a member `` china needs wto and wto also needs china without china i 'm afraid to say that the world trade organisation can not fully exert its influence '' li told asian and pacific businessmen in manila `` without the mutual recognition of diversity and stress on flexibility and without adherence to the principle of equality ... the development of the asia- pacific and world economy will be unattainable '' he added li said china the fastest growing market in the world was ready to join the world trade body but would not commit to what was beyond its means `` china being a developing country adheres to the principle that rights and obligations should be in balance and can not commit itself to what exceeds its capacity and ability '' li said li however said china would continue to pursue market-oriented reforms initiated by late paramount leader deng xiaoping he said average tariff rates in the country have been scaled down to 23 percent from 35.9 percent and will be subject to further reductions by the year 2000 `` this policy will not be changed and should not be changed ... china is capable of developing its economy in a sustained speedy and healthy manner '' he said wto director-general renato ruggiero said on tuesday that china must present an ambitious programme to open up its markets in its negotiations to join the trade watchdog china and its major trading partners will hold talks in geneva this month on beijing 's bid to join the wto -- manila newsroom 63 2 841-8938 fax 817-6267

treasury secretary robert rubin did not signal a departure from u.s. dollar policy on thursday but some analysts detected hints of a subtle shift in washington 's concern about the dollar 's rise against the yen while rubin stressed there was `` absolutely '' no change to washington 's policy that the strong dollar is in the united states interest some market participants are debating whether `` absolutely unchanged '' actually means a tiny bit changed in a speech to bank executives mitsuzuka said that recent yen moves were `` obviously excessive '' and cautioned that excessive moves would be dealt with `` decisively '' and in a `` timely manner '' eisuke sakakibara the influential director-general of the japanese ministry of finance 's international finance bureau also called the moves `` too rapid '' on thursday following earlier comments by japanese finance officials the treasury chief raised eyebrows in the currency market by saying he shared japan 's concerns about the recent weakening of the yen because of the impact on japan 's trade surplus `` what was different today is that the u.s. shares concerns about recent moves in the yen there is no way around it '' said david gilmore a partner at foreign exchange analytics in tokyo on thursday japanese finance minister hiroshi mitsuzuka issued one of the strongest warnings yet about the dollar 's recent sharp rise against the yen `` if japan is worried about the impact of a weak yen on its domestic economy on its trade balance and its relations with the u.s. then it begs the question that the u.s. probably shares the concern and perhaps shares the belief that intervention is warranted '' gilmore said rubin who delivered prepared comments on the dollar in conjunction with a live television interview on cnbc on thursday is extraordinarily careful in terms of how he delivers messages analysts said he seemed to have his ducks all in a row to deliver a message today gilmore said it would not be the first time rubin slightly altered his mantra about the strong dollar this year rubin signalled in early february that he was not particularly eager to see the dollar continue its unchecked advance when he began saying publicly that the u.s. currency has been strong for some time but concern by the u.s. over the weak yen does not necessarily translate as concern about the dollar 's current level near 126 yen instead analysts said rubin may be continuing to cautiously try to deprive the dollar of upward momentum the treasury secretary might have been signalling another very subtle transition on thursday before the dollar reached 130.00 yen they said `` any shift in policy is going to be a different shade of grey sort of thing '' said alan ruskin research director at i.d.e.a inc `` i have no doubt that they 'd like to slow this thing down ... i think they 've been forced to think on their feet and been forced to change the potential threshold as far as the dollar is concerned to where they suggest the japanese intervene i would still guess levels above 130 are going to be uncomfortable for all parties '' ruskin said rubin just returned from a six-day trip to asia during which he denied suggestions that he discussed curbing the dollar 's advance with japanese authorities but on his way to tokyo where he discussed japanese plans to deregulate their economy he also expressed concerns about japan 's rising trade surpluses however he later said he did not believe in using currencies as instruments of trade policy `` he was very discreet '' said earl johnson foreign exchange economist at bank of montreal in chicago of rubin 's comments on thursday `` he would n't be pushed into saying anything other than the strong dollar is in the best interests of the u.s `` the feeling seems to be he is willing to give japan some time but two or three months down the line if the japanese economy is not performing we may be beginning to put a little more pressure on `` obviously if the yen continues to weaken and the surpluses start to rise we may be a little less vocal in terms of a strong dollar '' johnson said -- 212 859 1667

russia 's double olympic champion denis pankratov blew his chances of a second short-course world record in consecutive days with a false start in the heats of a world cup meeting on sunday pankratov set a world record for the 200 butterfly on the first day of the meeting on saturday and looked capable of smashing the mark for the 100 race in the discipline but the russian who was deprived of two world records in paris last season because of an organisational blunder was judged to have taken off from his blocks too early in what should have been a straightforward 100 heat and was disqualified the mistake could turn out to be costly in addition to the 2,000 bonus swimmers earn for a world record on the world cup circuit pankratov had a chance of winning a car at the gelsenkirchen meeting the car is handed out to the best performance of the two-day event and a second world record would almost certainly have clinched it but pankratov took the mistake in his stride and was happy to laugh with reporters afterwards `` i wanted to swim quickly this morning and i was just unlucky '' he said apart from saturday pankratov seems to have had little luck with his record-breaking attempts in the 25-metre pool almost exactly a year ago pankratov 's world records in the 100 and 200 metres butterfly at a meeting in paris were not recognised because organisers failed to carry out drug tests but the russian on saturday clocked one minute 52.64 seconds in the 200 event to beat the previous best of 1:53.05 set by france 's franc esposito in paris in february 1994 there were some fast times in the sunday morning session of heats russian nina zhyvanevskaja set a european record for the women 's 100 backstroke when she clocked 58.99 seconds the finals take place later on sunday 1400 gmt

french magistrates on friday welcomed president jacques chirac 's plans to bolster the independence of the judiciary but some questioned his determination to get to the heart of sleaze in french politics in a televised interview on thursday chirac said he wanted the centre-right cabinet to initiate radical reform aimed at making public prosecutors independent of the justice ministry the daily le monde said chirac had broken `` a very french judicial taboo '' with the idea of scrapping a system that makes prosecutors subordinate to the ministry -- and open to charges of political manipulation the government caused an outcry last month by chartering a helicopter in a vain attempt to track down a prosecutor trekking in the himalayas to discuss a probe opened by his zealous deputy against the wife of the mayor of paris justice minister jacques toubon said it had been necessary to check whether the probe did not contradict the prosecutor 's instructions ths scandal caused charges that the government was trying to block an embarrassing probe judges and magistrates generally welcomed the planned reform and said they would help the work of any commission set up toubon said the commission of legal experts perhaps led by the head of the supreme court would be set up in coming days but some experts worried chirac 's announcement was window-dressing at a time when all political parties including the rally for the republic rpr chirac founded in 1976 are increasingly targeted by political funding scandals `` we will ensure that the work is not buried '' said valery turcey head of the centrist union syndicale des magistrats welcoming the proposed reform he said the rpr was `` ringed on all sides by the multiplication of corruption cases '' the leftist syndicat de la magistrature also said chirac 's proposal was `` interesting '' the right-wing apm magistrates group close to toubon expressed concern that cutting the link between prosecutors and the ministry could create an italian-style system that it said would let prosecutors act with too little control at the same time as considering reform of the judicial hierarchy chirac said he wanted to strengthen the presumption of innocence until any suspect was proven guilty some magistrates feared this could muzzle investigators and the media making it easier to hush up politically-embarrassing cases chirac also said he wanted to reduce bureaucratic hurdles that make it too expensive to prosecute minor crimes

briton colin mcrae took every conceivable risk on wednesday to beat spaniard carlos sainz and win the tour of corsica the 1995 champion who had started the last day of the rally in fourth position 22 seconds behind the spaniard 's ford escort clocked the best time in three of the final six timed stages for a brilliant victory before the final section over 34.33 kms from stiliccione to marati in the mountains south of ajaccio mcrae was second seven seconds behind sainz but he confirmed he was a formidable competitor with aggressive driving on wet asphalt to gain 15 seconds on his rival in that stretch alone `` i would have preferred dry conditions because we did n't do much testing with the rain tyres but it was okay '' said mcrae `` i did n't have much choice anyway my only option was to attack '' sainz had to settle for second place overall eight seconds behind while frenchman gilles panizzi came third a further 30 seconds back in his peugeot 306 `` i did n't know that last timed stage very much and i think colin 's tyres were better than mine for wet roads '' said sainz `` never mind it was a great battle i hope it was fun to watch '' there was bitter disappointment for panizzi 's team mate and compatriot francois delecour who shared the lead with sainz overnight hampered by a wrong choice of tyres and clutch problems delecour lost ground to end up fourth 55 seconds behind the leader mcrae who had been looking for a win since taking the safari rally in kenya last march retained second place in the world championship standings but is now only two points behind leader tommi makinen of finland world champion makinen crashed out of the rally when his mitsubishi lancer bumped into a cow on tuesday he has 28 points to mcrae 's 26 mcrae 's victory made up for a frustrating run in last month 's catalunya rally where he was fighting for the lead when a puncture forced him to drop to fourth place this year 's tour of corsica made particularly tricky by changing weather conditions with occasional downpours was marked by another fine perfomance from the lightweight two-wheel drive peugeots as in the catalunya rally where they led for much of the opening day before panizzi eventually finished third the puegeots matched the massive four-wheel drive cars panizzi was in the lead after the first day on monday and on tuesday delecour and panizzi were joint first and third respectively `` the choice of tyres was the most difficult thing in this rally '' said panizzi `` what mcrae did is just fantastic but i think we can be proud of what we 've achieved ''

russian finance minister anatoly chubais named three first deputy ministers on thursday but did not include andrei vavilov formerly in charge of eurobond issues and paris and london club relations chubais who was appointed finance minister and first deputy prime minister in a new reform cabinet last month told reporters alexei kudrin vladimir petrov and sergei ignatyev would be first deputies asked specifically about vavilov chubais responded `` vavilov 's fate is decided '' vavilov a first deputy finance minister since 1992 was spokesman for the ministry and in charge of the hard currency and external relations departments he was also chairman of the intra-government commission on foreign debt interfax news agency said vavilov could move to bank mfk though neither mfk nor the finance ministry confirmed that information -- moscow newsroom +7095 941 8520

u.s. defence secretary william perry said on tuesday that predictions that a new military peacekeeping force would go to bosnia were `` premature '' and that washington would make no commitment for u.s. participation until all alternatives had been studied `` i think all such judgements are premature i really do '' perry told reporters of predictions by german defence minister volker ruehe and others that a new international force would be sent to bosnia next year to replace the current nato-led force of 55,000 troops to be withdrawn in december perry spoke to reporters aboard his aircraft as he arrived in bergen for a two-day meeting of nato defence ministers to begin discussing whether to extend the peacekeeping mission in bosnia `` in the last analysis they other countries will reserve their final judgement until they see what the military requests are '' perry added `` i do n't think we the united states can have a position until we see what the request is what the mission is what the force structure requested is '' he added

hospodarske noviny budget revenues from tax and custom duty payments should be higher in 1997 by some 10 billion crowns against the previous year tax and custom payments in the first three months of 1997 exceeded the amount planned for the period by around two billion crowns the overall amount of tax and custom duty evasions decreased by some 6.3 billion crowns in 1996 and totalled 23.4 billion crowns at the end of the year oz kovo the largest trade union representing engineering sector employees said it would oppose this year 's general agreement with the government until new laws adjust the tax system in accordance with an increase in costs of living production in the textile and clothing industry decreased by 1.1 percent year-on-year in 1997 narodna obroda slovakia 's engineering sector recorded a 20 percent increase in production in 1997 over the previous year the main factor behind the increase was car production in volkswagen 's bratislava plant slovakia 's third largest commercial bank polnobanka a.s. posted a 1996 profit of 162.7 million crowns it did not say whether this figure was net or gross polnobanka 's balance sum increased by 35 percent year-on-year and totalled 29.1 billion crowns sme the paper quotes a collaborator of the slovak secret service the sis as saying the sis has carried out activities aimed to discredit president michal kovac including the kidnapping of his son in september 1995 finance minister sergej kozlik said the planned slovak- russian gas joint-venture could help slovakia to become more important corridor for the transfer of russian gas to western consumers -- bratislava newsroom 421-7-521-7-8402

south african president nelson mandela has told members of his african national congress they will decide who succeeds him as party leader state radio said the south african broadcasting corporation quoted sources at a weekend meeting of the anc 's national executive committee as saying mandela told delegates he had not endorsed deputy president thabo mbeki to be the next party leader mandela 78 has previously described mbeki as the kind of person who could step into his shoes mandela plans to resign when general elections are held in 1999 `` mandela says democratic procedures will be followed in the election of both the anc leader and president of the country when he steps down '' the sabc said `` he says he will leave the issue of his successor as party leader to the anc congress which is to be held next year '' many political and economic commentators had in recent months taken it as read that mbeki would succeed mandela the anc could not immediately be reached for comment on the radio report an official party statement on the nec meeting made no mention of the succession

israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu weathered criticism at a likud party congress on thursday over his landmark meeting with plo head yasser arafat but he vowed to take a hard line in peace talks with the palestine liberation organisation plo which his party had refused to recognise until his meeting with arafat on wednesday after netanyahu threatened to fire ministers who did not toe his line on peace moves infrastructure minister ariel sharon and science minister binyamin begin the most hawkish members of his cabinet made clear they had no fear of being sacked netanyahu began his speech with a party-pleasing broadside at former prime minister shimon peres who he defeated in may elections in which he rejected the plo 's goal of a state and hailed jewish settlement of the west bank and gaza strip `` you can dream every night ... and you will still wake up every morning and see there is no palestinian state there is no palestinian state there is not and there will not be a palestinian state '' he said to applause `` and jewish settlement in judea and samaria the west bank will live will thrive will exist forever '' he added palestinians say settlement must stop in answer to a heckler from the audience netanyahu said `` yes yes also in the gaza strip in gush katif certainly '' gush katif is the name of a block of jewish settlements in the gaza strip the rest of which has been handed over to palestinian rule under interim peace deals cut by the previous government netanyahu added he had expressed his commitment to settlement in the meeting with arafat `` whoever comes with complaints now did n't have to join the coalition and did n't have to join the government ... there is only one prime minister '' netanyahu said earlier in an interview with israel television asked if he would fire ministers who did not fall into line with his policy netanyahu had said `` if necessary yes '' sharon long a champion of jewish settlement and who said on wednesday the arafat meeting was a mistake was not cowed by the threat making a veiled one of his own `` it is possible to replace a minister ... governments can also be replaced '' sharon who has in the past referred to arafat as a war criminal said in his speech the party convention scheduled before the arafat meeting to deal with internal matters was overshadowed by the handshake on wednesday between the right-wing israeli leader and plo chief `` i did everything so this man could betray me and my friends ... what right did he have to go and shake the hand of this killer of children '' one member of the hundreds-strong central committee screamed on israel radio but sentiments in the hall were mixed backers of the meeting like likud member of parliament meir sheetreet said netanyahu was pragmatic and would ensure that a deal satisfying right-wing principles would result from negotiations
